Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice....!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia21082010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Yasmak Sultan Hotel in Istanbul during the Easter Holidays. The hotel is located in the historical centre of Istanbul, near the Gulhane Park and the tram station and just a breath away from all the famous sights of the city, such as St. Sofia Cathedral, Top Capi Palace and the Blue Mosque. Access to the karakoy Pier and the Galata Bridge is both easy either on foot or by taking the tram (one stop away). The area is nice to walk and safe at night. We were given a double room in the 2nd floor, the interior of which compined french design with elements of the oriental decoration, which we found smart, luxurious and cosy. Especially the ottoman style sofa bed. Our bed had a comfortable matress and was very very very ... clean. It also offered a satisfactory mini-bar and complimentary tea every day. Highlight of the hotel is the roof-garden with great view of the city. Breakfast was served every morning there and we found it a great way to start the day. Breakfast buffet was a 4 star hotel one. Overall, we can say that Yasmak Sultan Hotell has been a great choice for travellers, who wish to go sightseeing and live the atmosphere of the historical peninsula and also value for money. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ,cosy place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MarianaSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed enjoyfull 3 nights. This hotel is located in an area close to the main attractions to be seen. This area also provide many restaurants with good food at reasonable prices. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: thebeloved
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights on short notice. It was posh, lovely, and had great service and a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousPBeirut
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated, walking distance from the major Touristic Historical monuments. Staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Ahmet at reception. Recommendations of the staff are really good for a Tourist. Spa staff and service is exceptional, especially Mehmet and Nazifa. We had a great Honeymoon package that was memorable for us. Thank You Yasmak Sultan Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice located hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Bent V
Reviews.Content: We stayed enjoyfull 4 nights. This hotel is located in an area close to the main attractions to be seen. This area also provide many restaurants with good food at reasonable prices. Especially the Irish Pub less than 100 meter from the hotel was a visit worthwhile. In the evening many people from foreign countries visit this pub which gave a nice atmosphere and many funny hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay ....”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yasmak Sultan three nights ... two before our tour and one night on our return before departure. The Sultan is in the heart of the old district .. everything (Grand Bazaar, Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Spice Bazaar, Haga Sophia, waterfront) are within 5 minutes (or less) walking. Also shops and restaurants everywhere. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The gym is nicely appointed. They have a pool but we didn't try it although it was inviting.They were very conscious of the guests safety and well being, even calling the tour operator to confirm the identity of the driver sent to transport us back to the airport. The roof top restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced and overlooks the Bosphorous, Haga Sophia and Topkapi. Indeed one of our tour lunches was held there. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Spent our last night at the adjacent Yasmak Sultana (connecting sister hotel) with a triple occupancy in one of the harem suites ... wow! There is no doubt we will return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast, service and location”
Reviews.Author: AdiFiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and were extremely pleased with the decor of the room. The staff were friendly and always helpful. The breakfast had a wide choice and wasn't exactly the same everyday (as it is in some hotels), which it more interesting. The view from the rooftop restaurant was also very nice. At the reception they were always helpful, assisting us with tourist information, tours and even providing us with a weighing scale for our luggage. The hotel is walking distance to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. It is also conveniently located next to a main tram station. I would definitely return to this hotel the next time I visit Istanbul and would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great views”
Reviews.Author: d h
Reviews.Content: great small hotel, very friendly staff, who are always helpful with your travel/site seeing enquiries . top floor room had the best views as does the restaurant ..

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: 910Aurora
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul for my birthday and spent four nights at the Hotel Yasmak Sultan which is perfectly situated in the old historic part of Istanbul giving easy access to the main attractions. The warmth and hospitality of the staff was amazing and they helped to give me a perfect birthday. After a relaxing Haman Turkish Bath and treatment at the Hotel Wellness Centre we ate in their roof top Olive Restaurant with it's fabulous views, deliciously prepared food and accompanied with an excellent turkish wine helped to make a great birthday. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and the buffet breakfast is excellent. We would highly recommend this hotel for a perfect stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, very good location. Ongoing upgrade and hotel will improve even more.”
Reviews.Author: lillesten
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Istanbul and Hotel Yasmak Sultan is situated in a perfect location in the old historic part of Istanbul. This being the third time to Istanbul, we knew what to look for in a hotel. It is not situated just next to a mosque which can be fun the first night or two, but if you want to sleep make sure you're a couple of hundred meters away from one. The hotel has a small swimming pool/fitness centre and a sauna open for the guests and you may also enjoy a Turkish Hamam if you want to. The rooftop terrace and restaurant is also very nice and we enjoyed many hours on the terrace. The hotel is of some age and unfortunately it is not very well sound proofed. You could hear most of what was going on in the hallway, but they are doing a major renovation and we could see that they were changing the doors, so hopefully this will improve.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: HeatherS50
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Yasmak Sultan Hotel and could not have been more delighted. On the first night we drank Turkish red wine on the rooftop terrace and watched cranes swooping over Hagia Sophia as the sun set. We ate twice in the Olive Restaurant with its brilliant views and found the food to be excellent - a modern take on traditional Turkish cuisine. The hotel is an easy walk to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace so ideal for sightseeing. The Basilica Cistern (also close) is well worth a visit. All the staff at the Yasmak Sultan go out of their way to be friendly and helpful and demonstrate that they really want you to have a great time in Istanbul - which we did.

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 151Terry
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a real gem. We came on recommendation from friends and cannot speak to highly about it. Our room was very comfortable and the Hotel is very well placed for all the key attractions of Istanbul which are very close. However, the real superlatives begin with the welcome, friendliness and helpfulness of the fantastic staff for whom nothing is too much trouble. Pindar at the front of house is wonderful and we enjoyed some terrific trips organised by her. The restaurant is also excellent, and the buffet breakfast quite amazing in content and quality; I must have gained a couple of kilos in 4 days. The views from the restaurant by day and night are wonderful. I really cannot wait to return to Istanbul, and will recommend this wonderful Hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Elivara
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay. It's very close to major attractions. Clean, friendly, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services”
Reviews.Author: fadychreih
Reviews.Content: excellent services from the entire personnel (reception, guest relations, breakfast, spa) 4 min walk from Sophia Mosque. great variety at breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pamela W
Reviews.Content: Staff at hotel are very warm and friendly, food in restaurant is excellent ( so is the view!) and the hotel is extremely convenient for the major sights in Istanbul and for public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: yuryMoscow_Russia
Reviews.Content: We visited Istambul for the first time and selected this hotel because of good reputation and location. The room was comfortable and clean. The staff â€“ friendly and efficient with sincere wishes to help and resolve our small problems even after we have already checked outâ€¦ . It was very good breakfast and fantastic view from top roof restaurant. So we liked everything and hope to stay here again next time

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: DRD1965
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. This was the first time in stayed in Sirkeci. The door guy and one of the front desk person was great. The only thing they should, offer is free Internet service. The rooms are good size. The breakfast was good and the food was replenished promptly. The only thing is the servers could be more friendly and ask of you need anything. Some did this but not all. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was a nice place to stay and the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Our Accomodation in Yasmak Sultan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eman A
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in , the staff were so friendly and helpful. on my husbad's birthday , the morning staff made a surprise cake and sang to him while we were having our breakfast. to add on that, when we returned to our room in the afternoon, they made for us a surprise in including romantic roses and turkish delights ( for our anniversary ) with nice words written on a very elegant card...... how sweet is that <3 in general, the atmosphere of the hotel and the service, besides the location were all perfect. and definitely Yasmak Hotel would be our choice next time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent birthday break”
Reviews.Author: Margaret A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in February 2012 and were really pleased with the hotel. It was very conveniently located for the main sights in Sultanahmet. We didn't use public transport at all as all was within walking distance. Room very comfortable with comfortable bed, quiet at night. Lovely rooftop restaurant with views of the Bosphorus, and I even got a special birthday cake - they must have noticed from the birth date in my passport! We would recommend the hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: jcprobinson
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 4 day break in Feb 2012. The staff were very freindly. The views around Istanbul from the top floor restaurant / breakfast room were superb. Every day we spent over an hour over breakfast, enjoying the food and the sights. Lots to see in Istanbul. The Turkish people seemed freindly. The weather was cold with a touch of snow / rain but we avoided the crowds and had a great time. The beds were fairly comfortable - my wife slept well. I found the noise of the mini bar too loud - apparently "all the mini bar fridges were the same". There were no chairs in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: gaoudalaks
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for its location and good reputation, and it fullfilled our expectations. Nice and very helpfull and efficient staff. Very good breakfast, view, location. The rooms comfortabel, clean and quiet. For us it was a great experience staing with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irina Z
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel in the heart of Sultanahment is ideal in order to see the most important objectives. The food is amazing, with so many choices even for a vegetarian! The restaurant has amazing views. The rooms are very cozy and very clean. The service is at highest quality, we were impressed how kind and willing to help was everybody. It will certainly be the choice of my next visit in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Cathy S
Reviews.Content: My favourite hotel in Istanbul. Fantastic location, breathtaking views from the restaurant and excellent service. Standard rooms possibly on the small side but with so much on your doorstep to explore, that's really not an issue!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Visitor O
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel,with a very good location. All staf is very friendly and welcome. Food is really good and tasty. Rooms are nice and clean. Next time I will book the same hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliWagner
Reviews.Content: I have been living in Istanbul for the past 5 months going to school and when my parents came to visit we found this hotel in the tourist district. It is a five minute walk away from Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. This hotel has a great staff, location and facilities. The price is quite reasonable, since it is in the middle of the tourist district. The hotel is also a minute walk away from the Gulhane tram stop. Although the room and the bathroom were a bit on the small size, it is likely due to us trying to get the cheapest room. Great restaurants around this hotel too. I highly recommend you book this hotel if you are looking for comfort and aren't too worried about prices (if you are, you should really be looking for hostels).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sunset71
Reviews.Content: As a frequent senior business traveller with enough experience in several hotels around I cannot praise the Yasmak Sultan Hotel enough. It deserves to be closer to the Tripdvisor top hotels in Istanbul since they give you much more in quantity and quality than other hotels in the area with the same level of prices. These are my reasons: First of all, its location is spot on right next to the principal sights -by walking distance- but also with a tram stop just around the corner for those wanting to move by local transportation. Premises: Every time I go to Yasmak Sultan Hotel I find something added or renovated in the building. The lobby is a broad and pleasant area where clients can relax by taking a drink. Rooms are clean, spacious, comfy beds and all necessary furniture to have a comfortable stay. Toilets are well equipped with lots of toiletries beyond what it is normally offered for hotels of the same range. For example, if you forgot something like razors, dental paste, etc they provide them for you. If you forgot your tooth brush then they provide you a dental kit, if you got a sewing problem then they give you a sewing kit, and so on. Breakfast: They offer a good selection of hot and cold food including different kinds of bread, pastries, sweet and salt items, vegetables and fruits with some types of hot and cold drinks. You can take as much as you can for a good starting. As a plus, people can eat enjoying the magnificent view at the Bosphorus from one side and the Hagia Sophia in the other side. Also, for those wanting to have dinner in the Restaurant, it is fair to say that the Chef has been awarded and recognised by top cuisine magazines in Istanbul. The meals there are based in a special combination of Ottoman cuisine with an international touch, as a result the cuisine is excellent with a peculiar taste. Another tip is that the restaurant is open 24 hours and they also offer room service late in the nights, that is something not common in many hotels around which tend to close kitchens earlier. SPA: The Yasmak Sultan is a sister hotel of the beautiful Sultania Hotel, they both offer an excellent level of service for Turkish massages, sauna, Turkish baths, plus the free use of the swimming pool and gym. Again, only few hotels of the same category can provide these additional services on top. Service: This is the key word for Yasmak, service, service, service. From the very beginning one enters the premises and up to the last minute to leave it, everyone and I mean everyone makes every effort to make people to stay comfortable. For reasons of space, I cannot praise every one; however, I want to particularly thank Engin- the man who solves any problem or concern there- ask for him as he is always willing to help. Ahmet, Orhan, Mesut and Hilmi (the reception guys ready to assist in their best way), Sedat, the cute boy at the Lobby bar (ask for him to prepare a nice Turkish drink named 'Salep') and the lovely Guest Relations, Pinar who goes beyond expectations to welcome guests. At the Restaurant, I want to thank Murat, Mehmet and Zeynep for being always smiling and taking care of me very well. For all the reasons above, I find the Yasmak Hotel as a place where it is possible to find everything you want and more as compared to other hotels of the same level and category. It is a nice building with an excellent environment and service, and that is why I don't hesitate to recommend it to every one!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely enjoyable stay, with an incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: Kavegirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Yasmak Sultan for a few nights with our 11 month old daughter. Firstly, they met us at the airport and were so welcoming and explaining the city to us on our way to the hotel. All the staff there were very sweet, informative and welcoming. The lobby, bar, restaurant, rooms, we're all clean and had a nice vibe. Travelling with an infant can be challenging, but our stay there was seamless and enjoyable. The complimentary breakfast spread was the biggest and tastiest we've ever had! Would definitely return to the Yasmak Sultan!

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Retepetat
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Good facilities and the roof top view is exceptional. Our room was changed hurriedly as the one allocated, a nice large room, was occupied, our changed room was cramped but functional. Several of our companions did complain of their rooms being too hot but ours was fine. The situation is spot on. A good but not great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great base to discover old Istanbul from”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend in Australia, who said it was well located and very comfortable. I was not disappointed. The rooms met all our requirements, breakfast was exceptional (also with excellent views of major landmarks), and service was great (with staff providing useful advice on trams etc to see varoius landmarks. The gym and pool and sauna in the basement was good for relaxing, in between sight-seeing! Without any prompting, the hotel staff recogised my wife's birthday with a cake at breakfast, which was a nice touch. I will stay here again when next in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: wilhelmina
Reviews.Content: New rooms are not as good as the old , first floor was very noisy could hear rooms above as well as next door. Breakfast was great apart from having to pay for orange juice .Very odd for a so called 4 star hotel.Staff in restaurant / breakfast room were friendly and helpful.Reception ws hit and miss depending who was on. Good food in the restaurant. Rooms were very clean but pillows were like a rock. If sleep is important to you due to the excessive noise levels from other rooms at night I would go else where. Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “best location for old istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Scotsmidge
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 4 nights at this hotel with 4 other couples and were delighted with it. The view from the rooftop restaurant alone makes it worth a visit with the Bosphorus on one side and Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia on the other. Breakfast there was very good and although we prefered to eat out in the evening, the menu looked iteresting and reasonably priced. Lobby bar has a mesmerising, huge tank of colourful fish to entertain guests! Rooms are quite small as this is an old hotel but very comfortable with good sized bathrooms - although the water flow was rather slow. Some problems with the air conditioning which had a mind of its own - despite being set at 18, it achieved 27 degrees on our first night so we didn't use it again, but were perfectly warm enough and the windows opened anyway. Our friends whose lights kept fusing were given another room immediately. Some of our party used the Spa treatments and were pleased with them, while I enjoyed the [verysmall] swimming pool to relax. Immaculately clean everywhere with super wetroom shower. All staff were excellent and keen to help, both with hotel items and tourism advice. Location is second to none in quite a quiet street but only 10 mins walk from Hagia Sofia, The Cisterns etc and 15 mins the other way to the Bosphorus quayside. Price is very reasonable and I recommend the hotel for city break guests.

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan”
Reviews.Author: Reene M
Reviews.Content: Build in the old istanbul, the hotel is occupied due to its proximity to the tourist spots and the tram. The hotel is situated ideally and its restaurant on the top has an amazing view than looks over to the new istanbul. Its an old hotel and in need of renovation. The service of hotel staff is not that great but there are few staff who are approachable and fantastic there. If you are going to spend the entire day outside and only come back to the hotel to sleep then this is an ideal place. The hotel doesn't have connecting room. But they will bring amenities like kettle, iron and other much needed tools if requested.Before i left, i was informed that sometimes the hotel would have AC issues but the rooms we stayed in didn't have any. Its a pretty average hotel that could turn into something good.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Rashida H
Reviews.Content: Great location and very helpful staff. Piner at the guest service was very friendly and helpful.Good variety at the breakfast bar with outstanding views over looking the harbour. Rooms are small however we were ungraded to a larger room without extra charge:-) Internet was very disappointing and not even once did we have excess to internet in our room. Overall a good hotel with great staff:-)

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan Review of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alina S
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go on an awesome trip to Istanbul so our travel agent booked us our tickets, airport pick up (don't do it, it's too expensive and taxis are pretty good and safe), several tours (don't book from home, again too expensive the hotel will take care of the bookings for you at much much much better prices, lots of tours so you WILL get tickets) and the most important part of any exciting yet comfortable journey-OUR HOTEL YASMAK SULTAN. The hotel is located right in the heart of old city which is where you really want to stay to experience the amazing cultural heritage of the city. So it was within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and many other landmarks. But Yasmak Sultan exceeded our expectations in so many other ways. First of all we felt SAFE and looked after by members of staff: so the concierge made phone calls for us when we needed because we don't speak Turkish (taxis, and drivers where exactly we wanted to go and the price we had to pay, tickets bookings,), the restaurant staff were very attentive and the maid was just excellent, she even made our room look very beautiful for my birthday.The concierge made note of when we left the hotel and when we came back because my mother called to check on us and since we were rarely in our room gave her detailed accounts of where we were which was great and made us feel secure. The most important thing we didn't feel like people were going to rip us off. Prices are fair all around at the hotel: so if you want a very nice Turkish bath experience just book it there don't hesitate, it's reasonably priced and everything is super clean and tidy. The people who do the massages are a couple and they both are amazing, friendly and professional. Also we often drunk coffee/beer upstairs in the hotel restaurant which has very nice views that you see every morning when having your breakfast. Food was very good and well catered for vegetarians, which was great for me. So, we would most definitely stay there again and can confidently recommend it! D&A

Reviews.Title: “Top location for getting a feel of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BMJAK
Reviews.Content: Particularly when visiting a city for the first time I try and identify a hotel in a central location within walking distance of many of the major sites - a tough call in Istanbul as there are so many! First impression is of a small hotel tucked up a side street. But in reality it is ideally located to walk to many of the 'must-see' attraction of this enchanting city, and only a 2 minute walk from public transport. The Yasmak Sultan is in a suburb dominated by small hotels and surrounded by dining opportunities. The restaurant touts get a bit wearing when out walking but in reality every meal we had was very good. The Yasmak's roof-top restaurant and bar have fantastic views and very good food. We dined there one night when we were too tired to go hunting for dinner and found the menu a long way from traditional, predictable hotel fare. Very good food at reasonable prices. The rooms aren't big, but are of a good standard and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: DavidHilton1
Reviews.Content: The Yasmak Sultan is located right in the heart of the Istanbul Old City and is convenient for travelling anywhere in the city you could like. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Hippodrome are a five-minute walk away, past excellent restaurants, pubs and coffee shops. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant too was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “My stay in Yasmak”
Reviews.Author: Fatima A
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good room, services and all kind of information needed souced by the reception. I am sure that i will shoose it for next trips. nd i wish that next time it will be some changes regarding sauna facility which should be free not paid, as the hotel does not have a lot of big amenties(small swiming pool!) at least the sauna must be free and also some opinion regarding breakfast the frech jus should be free especially for accommodation including breackfast. because is not logic that people take breackfast with additional fee on general the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jessica_general
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel before.amazing! Location: perfect Rooms: beautiful Reception: helpful, nice... I loved it. Worth the money. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “November vacation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Svetulya A
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve recently been in Istanbul and we stayed at this hotel. Because of low season the price was very attractive. The service was at high level. It was convenient and nice that the hotel provided free transfer, but you should write details about your arrival in advance. When we landed and took our luggage, the transfer man came almost at that time and we didnâ€™t have to wait. Itâ€™s so pleasant of hotel service. We were met very friendly in hotel, then before paying we were shown our room and we were given sometime to decide if we liked our room or not. So we had enough time to assess the room without hurrying. We booked a standard room; it looked like at the photo. The breakfast at the hotel was very good too. There were cold starters, hot dishes. In spite of the end of warm season there were sliced fruits and vegetables, fruit salads too. This cafÃ© where the breakfast was served was situated on the roof and you can enjoy the view of Istanbul and Bosporus. This cafÃ© on the roof has open aired and non-open aired areas which are very convenient when the weather is changing, sometimes it may be cold and windy, but other time it can be warm. Among advantages I also would like to notice that there are sauna and covered swimming pool, fitness center in this hotel. They all are situated together; also you can ask fresh juice from different fruits or other drinks for some pay and relax on the chaise longue. The people working in this hotel are very friendly and nice. I want to note among disadvantages that our room was small, and fresh juice offered at the breakfast and visiting sauna wasnâ€™t included in the room fee, though itâ€™s unusual for European four-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff”
Reviews.Author: MohmmedAlmalki
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice location and excellent staff good idea about car service and parking I recommended for stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A holiday rescued”
Reviews.Author: AussieRichard
Reviews.Content: For the second year running, my wife and I stayed at this hotel. The first time, by chance and we were so pleased; with the staff, the closeness to various sites and their super restaurant. This year, in September, we were picking up a cruise in Istanbul and chose to return. We were not disappointed, particularly being upgraded to a suite. Well worth it!. We had a serious problem at the Airport, being 'parted' from some of our onward travel documents. The staff at the hotel were superb. I know they're supposed to help, but the dedicated efforts, particularly of Ms. Oslem Kaya, of Guest Relations, rectified all our problems within the first two days. Once again, our hotel selection was proved correct, we shall return!.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: seas0nedtraveler61
Reviews.Content: Turkey was all the more enjoyable for having stayed at the Yashmak Sultan Hotel. the first night we were offered an upgrade to the suite with a round bay window. very bright and spacious. we were then given a room on the upper floor which was a bit smaller but equally comfortable. the breakfast on the terrace was very generous and the view of the Bosphorus interesting. the staff at the Hotel were all very attentive and curteous. Its central location made it easy to walk to the Blue Mosque and the Haggia Sophia. Also very close to the Topkapi Museum. a very happy and comfortable stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “small and nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: pattyann47
Reviews.Content: great location right near tram and close to tourist area. Wonderful service and full breakfast on rooftop with nice view but unbelievably loud at night, at least if you have a room facing the street. The air conditioning is not individually controlled by room and also is not available during shoulder season when it can still be quite warm. However, they were kind and apologetic and did up a fan. Nothing could be done about the noise and we aren't even noise-sensitive. Right around the block is the Hotel Prince which is a bit more elegant and while no rooftop dining it is nevertheless a step up for the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Istanbul hotel”
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 x 3 nights in October in this lovely hotel. It is really centrally located within walking distance to all the tourist sites. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate with hot and cold items on the top floor surrounded by glass with a view of the Bosphorus. The reception staff without exception was very helpful. When our personal tour guide was unable to come on one day the reception got us a guide on very short notice (1 hour), which was amazing. As other reviews have mentioned, avoid the top floor as the restaurant directly above will transmit noise from chairs and hard soled shoes dragging across the wood floor. Great bed and good pillows.

Reviews.Title: “A Sultan for 4 Nights”
Reviews.Author: johnnyh18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights in early September 2011 at this hotel. We obtained a 3 day special package plus 1 extra day arranged by the hotel. We were very well looked after by the staff who were quite friendly and professional. The room was great with all amenities needed, and the breakfast was of a good quality and indicative of turkish cuisine. The Olive restaurant provided exceptional night time views of the city, and the manager of the restaurant went out of his way to make our dinner memorable. The hotel is centrally located to all the sights in the old quarter of Istanbul, and the many and varied restaurants around the hotel, provided an excellent choice for dining out. Shopping was also excellent in the surrounding area. A few phrases of turkish (learned before our trip) also went down well with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: NileGuy77
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the price , location, and decent reviews I found on Trip Advisor. The hotel was full when we arrived so they kept us waiting in the lobby for 3 hours until check out time. The rooms are very small, you can barely move around. And a tip: NEVER take the rooms on the top floor because you will be woken up with every chair and table pushed in the restaurant on the roof! The breakfast is amazing for this small hotel, all fresh produce from Turkish farms. The reception staff are very helpful and provide you with all the info and directions you need. The metro station is also very close so its easy to be in the middle of it all in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “great location/ average hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgeconstanza
Reviews.Content: the location is great for a first time visit to Istanbul, a few minutes away from Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, etc... the hotel is normal but I can't accept that at 190â‚¬/ night you have to pay extra 5TL to drink orange juice at breakfast! It also didn't feel quite ok that the hotel has offered a private car to take to the hotel (at 35â‚¬) when they had the shuttle leaving at same time for 5â‚¬.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Going the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: firebuff
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel with very nice rooftop breakfast that comes with gorgeous view of city. Easy to walk to the major tourist sites. A tram stop also down the block for convenience. When I asked for help in visiting a local fire station, as is my hobby. the front desk clerk not only located a station, but offered to take me there when he finished work. He did, stayed to translate for me, and than dropped me back at hotel. He never asked to be compensated. How that for service!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: linbin45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Yasmak Sultan Hotel for 3 nights. It is a wonderful place for to stay. It was superbly comfortable. All the staff were helpful and friendly. This hotel is in great location only 5 minutes walking distance from old city (Agha Sofia,TopkapÄ± Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar)staff very friendly and helpful 24 hours.whenever you need them they help you. It was an unforgettable stay for us. My friends are planning visit to Istanbul and I already recommend them to stay in Yasmak sultan hotel I would definitely stay here again. We had a room on the 4th floor and didn't hear any street noise. We loved the Olive Restaurant- the fish in salt crust was super!â€� The two waiters Mustafa and Murat were outstanding, friendly and helpful with superb service. I would stay again and recommend the Yasmak Sultan without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Murray C
Reviews.Content: The position was convenient, wonderful staff who were so helpful, a most enjoyable hotel to stay in! Modern rooms which were not over the top and friendly and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: lyagywonok
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. On the one hand, we booked only standard room but stayed in the nice junior suite room for 3 out of 4 nights. On the other hand, at our arrival we were denied a room in the main building and spend a night in basic, small and cold room in another building with the view of construction site. Pros: - comfortable sleeping conditions; - central location in the historical part of Istanbul, great for tourist trips; -rather good rate. Cons: - not a 4-star breakfast; - there are better rooftop restaurant options in the nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great service , great location , friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: guapo_1905
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Yasmak Sultan Hotel for 3 nights.It is a wonderful place for to stay.It was superbly comfortable,clean ( which is very important for me) and warm with smily and friendly staff.This hotel is in great location only 5 minutes walking dictence from old city (agha sofia,topkapÄ± palace,blue mosque.)staff very friendly and helpful 24 hours.whenever you need them they help you.Ä±t was one of unforgettable stay for me. My friends are planning visit to Istanbul and I already recommend them to stay in Yasmak sultan hotel.And they did reservation for to stay in this lovely hotel.I ll definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: sunina s
Reviews.Content: My Family and I visited Turkey a few months back and stayed at Hotel Romance which is a sister hotel for Yasmak Hotels. This Hotel was very, very nice. The staff couldn't be more polite and helpful with all our needs. The Location was great and we had a great time. Our only down fall was when we checked in, we wanted a family room, for my husband, me and little one, we had to settle for three single beds. This was not how we thought we would get a family room however it was still very comfy and their service made up any little disappointment I had. Would defo go back to them and would say to any one, you won't be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan Hotel = The Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed_Mostafa
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a lot to Istanbul, without any exaggeration I must say Yasmak Sultan Hotel has been one of the best hotels that I had experienced so far... - I believe the hotel staff is the efficient secret to make this hotel very successful, & I would like to send greetings and special thanks to "Ozlem Kadayifci" the Guest Relations Manager for all assistance and advices she had provided during my stay, where make the trip wonderful and much more than perfect. - The hotel's front desk staff had a genuine smile, friendly and polite, willing to be helpful at all the time, Special Thanks to Mr. Ingin, Mr. Mesut & Mr. Ahmet; - Extraordinary cleaning service, the housekeeping staff are making rooms very shiny & bright, they own a real magical touch, I had tried many times to find cleaning faults but I failed to find anything :-) - The service is very professional & exemplary with genuine hospitality. - The Rooms are spacious, very comfortable, and tidy with lovely extra touches here and there, itâ€™s designed to match the five stars standards. - Free Wi-Fi strongly covered everywhere in the hotel. - The Breakfast restaurant â€œOliveâ€� is fabulous and has a great view to the old town; also it has alot of fresh and tasty food varieties. - Wonderful (24/7) Room Service, quick responding to any request at any time. - The value for money is fair comparing to the great service which they provide. - The location is very nice, safe, quiet & very close to "Istanbul Old Town", 1 Minute walking to Tram station, as well as all transportation are available in this area to reach everywhere in Istanbul. I would extremely recommend this hotel to anyone who are seeking a wonderful experience and getting a luxury service during his trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel. Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: O'Polo
Reviews.Content: Goof clean hotel. Rooms are rather small but convenient enough. Bathroom idem. Good restaurant with nice view on Bosporus and Hagia Sophia. Staff is friendly and helpfull. Good location close to most of the touristic must-see places. Wide range of good restaurants close by. Tram practically on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “I hope to come again!”
Reviews.Author: Burushaski
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, is closed to all the historical sightseeings just around the corner you find Hagja Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi. Services are good and people are kind, we spent a great time there. The receptionist is very polite and breakfast is very good. I would suggest to reserve in the hotel a place for smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: trixie297
Reviews.Content: Don't stay on the first floor as they are renovating the second floor and the building noise goes on to midnight It is right above your head. They moved us to the fifth floor underneath the roof top restaurant! This hotel is in a great location for sight seeing etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location. A wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: Erin M
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Yasmak after receiving a recommendation from a family friend. We were very pleased -- the hotel was a nice, small hotel with a boutique feel. The breakfast buffet was incredible. We celebrated our last day by having Turkish coffee on the rooftop terrace. A must. Ozlem, the customer relations manager, was incredibly helpful and friendly. She pointed us in the right direction each day. She went above and beyond by organizing our very early morning trip to the airport. They even had breakfast "to go" for us at 5am and provided free car service. Simply outstanding. My one small complaint was a very loud family staying down the hall from us but this was out of the hotel's control. The walls are a little thin. I highly recommend this wonderful hotel! Thank you, Yasmak!

Reviews.Title: “We were well cared for, very helpful staff great location”
Reviews.Author: garmBallarat
Reviews.Content: Roof top resturant was an added bonus with fabulous views. Variety of food and good service

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings About This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merran97
Reviews.Content: After a flight from Athens and the usual "let's get to the hotel" situation the reception we received was not what was expected. The man on the desk was very unhelpful bordering on rude. On checking in and receiving our key, I informed we had booked a 1/2 day tour and a transfer to the airport on our departure. The stare was blank and quite frustrating as tours/transfers were not invented last week. We had to change our room as they are renovating the 2nd floor and the noise was awful. Again, this was met with a "the noise stops around 6pm". Not good enough. The plus side was another staff member showed us another room above the noise and not only was the noise problem lessened but the room much bigger. Make sure you test your pillows as our were like bricks and this was my mistake I forgot to get them changed,for softer ones. Breakfast was good and the location is terrific for seeing the sights. Would I stay here again? I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Isawju
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, realy close to the turistic sites! The rooms are good, clean but the service is not the best. The peoble from the recepcion desk dont speak good english and didn't help with anything, restaurants, maps, locations, reservations... They let everything for you to solve by your selve.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: _wanderer_2727
Reviews.Content: rooms are really tiny, indeed hotel itself is so tiny too... however in a great location in historical Istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel to stay in when visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DavidandRuth2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for exploring the historical part of Istanbul. It is only 50 metres to the tram which runs every two minutes Walking distance to Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Gulhane Gardens and the Cistern. Only two tram stops to the ferries and Egyptian Spice Bazaar, or the Grand Bazaar. Hotel is in a safe and quiet location, but close to the action if needed. Hotel is beautifully presented and the rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable, with lovely bathrooms. Roof-level breakfast room/restaurant has a wonderful view of the Golden Horn and the Galata bridge, as well as Aya Sophia. Breakfast is very extensive and beautifully presented and staff are all very helpful and friendly. The wellness centre is beautifully presented for a day of pampering, a swim, massage, workout in the gym or a sauna. We would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and attentive hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandraB56
Reviews.Content: Yasmak was our introduction to Istanbul and it was a great experience..staff was attentive, helpful and welcoming. Rooms are average size for the old city area but comfortable and clean. Breakfast was great on a roof-top restaurant with lots of variety and wonderful selection of cheeses, olives and breads. Staff kindly prepared a box breakfast for us on the day of leaving as our departure was early. Close to all old city sites, waterfront and restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located for sight seeing in the Old City”
Reviews.Author: Griff337
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel ideally located within walking distance of the major historical sites of the Old City of Constantinople/Istanbul. A nearby tram route makes it easy to reach the Grand Bazaar without tiring the older ones. There is a very good restaurant on the top-level and many reasonably priced restaurants within close walking distance for the budget conscious. Staff are very friendly and helpful with a special mention for Guest Relations Manager Ozlem.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: minheit
Reviews.Content: Hotel Yasmak Sultan is a gem of a hotel in the old city within walking distance to major attractions. The tram stop is 20 metres away and is free for people with a disabilty and their companion. The rooms are well outfitted, clean and comfortable and we had an early check in as our room was ready. The Olive restaurant on the rooftop of the hotel has an awesome view. The complimentary breakfast is more than ample with a great selection of traditional Turkish food and westernised food. Room service is great value for money. The greatest assett to the hotel is the Guest Relations Officer - Ozlem. She visits all guests at breakfast with suggestions of an all day itinerary to use your time best, gives valuable knowledge on bartering and the best shopping areas and makes all guests welcome. The free wi-fi we had difficulties connecting from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Glitterfly
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect - easy to get to by metro, close to tourist sites. It is on a oneway street, but we had a room in the back (not on the street side), so our room was very quiet. We didn't have a room with a good view of anything - just the building next to us - not a problem - we were out sightseeing most of the time anyway. Room was clean and it was a good size, bathroom was clean. We could NOT get a Wifi connection in our room at all, and it was spotty in the lobby as well. we had the best connection in the pub down the street. The staff was extremely attentive and helpful with everything (directions, obtaining a shuttle for the airport, etc.) The restaurant Olive is amazing - beautiful views, fabulous food. we ate dinner there the first night and it spoiled us - we had to go back another night for dinner. The free breakfast was great - there were so many food and drink choices - it was a great way to start each day.

Reviews.Title: “We are absolutely staying there during our next visit!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Rana
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to thank all the people who provided their comments as that was very helpful when selecting the hotel. I stayed at Yasmak Sultan Hotel with my mother and sister for 5 days/ 4 nights and it was one of the most pleasant experiences we ever had. The guys at the reception were kind enough to grant us an early check in and a late check out. They were so amazing and helpful when arranging for our tours as well â€“ always cheerful and supportive. And ofcourse the wonderful Ozlem, who was kind enough to check on the guests one by one and actually took the time to sit with each one of them at breakfast time to assist with tips and information about the city. The rooms were well equipped and kept very clean and tidy. We usually find it difficult to adjust to sleeping in hotel rooms the first night, but that was not the case with Yasmak Sultan as the rooms were really comfortable. The breakfast at the Olive restaurant (rooftop restaurant) was such an experience with the amazing Hagia Sophia view. The food at Olive (whether for breakfast, lunch, or dinner) was much better than the nearby restaurants in the area and the staff were really nice. The hotel is located within walking distance from all the major attractions in the city; it is also 2 steps away from the tram station which makes it even easier to move around. All in all, it was an amazing experience which couldnâ€™t get any better â€“ thanks to Yasmak Sultan and its entire staff. We are absolutely staying there during our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ane86
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Yasmak Sultan for 6 nights and had a brilliant time. The breakfast was great with the view on Ayah Sofia. The staff were extremely helpful and despite the heat and lots of work they always smiled. Particularly Zaynep and Gulhan (sorry guys, I did not take note of your names otherwise I would mention it here as well) and all the reception staff. Must mention Hava who cleaned our rooms and gave us special service too. The provide a tray of fruits for guests in the reception area which is a great touch as we had not seen that before. The hotel's location is great too. All the sights are within walking distance and the tram stop is very close by. It is also within walking distance to the sea. If we went back to Istanbul we would definitely stay at Yasmak Sultan

Reviews.Title: “Best guest relations officer in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: veroph
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed for 3 nights in Yasmak Sultan and totally recommend it! The guest relations officer (Ozlem) was wonderful with us! She gave us lots of tips on what to do & visit in Istanbul, booked lovely restaurants for us and was amazingly friendly and helpful during our stay there. WeÂ´ve never experienced such a nice welcome before!! IÂ´d gave her 5 stars! The hotel is also very conveniently located (a short walk from the main visiting sites) and the staff is also fantastic. Breakfast was good with plenty to choose from and the free internet access works great. We also used the gym and spa facilities every afternoon after touring the city all day -it was so nice to relax there before dinner! All in all a wonderful stay that we hope to repeat one day!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: sidneybilski
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in late May, taking 3 rooms in total. The staff were fantastic, with special thanks to Ozlem, the guest relations manager. She managed to locate my daughter's doll after we left it behind, and even sent a driver to the airport with a bowl which we had left by mistake at reception. The hotel location is fantastic, the breakfast amazing and everything superb all around. This was my 4th trip to Istanbul and was by far the best experience I have had at any hotel there. Very special thanks to Ozlem who was an absolute star.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthCounty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and a host of other attractions in the city. In addition, there is a great little bar just across the street and a few streets in any direction and you in the midst of Istanbul and all its excitement. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous even allowing for the fact that our plane landed near midnight and by the time we got to the hotel, it was going on 1 in the morning. Neverthess we were treated with the utmost attention and courtesy. The rooms are not particularly spacious but are very clean, well appointed and the hotel has a great amount of charm. The food was good and the view of the city and Blue Mosque from the dining room is spectacular. All in all, this hotel is well worth the stay. We were there for three nights total and enjoyed every moment. One word of caution, not specifically about this hotel but about Turkey in general, wake up calls are not one of the country's strong suits. Bring a small alarm clock with you and use it even though you may have submitted a request for a wake up call. We found the actual getting of a call to be sporadic at best. BTW, Turkey, the country and it's people, are wonderful. They are accomodating and friendly as was the staff at the Yazmak Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “Definately the place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Cowfarmergirl
Reviews.Content: A simply wonderful place to stay - not only is it so central to everything we wanted to see, but it was a superbly comfortable, safe haven in the wildly energetic city of Istanbul. The reception staff were professional, helpful and attentive. When I received a letter from customs (written in Turkish), the front desk staff spent at least 30 minutes on the phone, trying to sort out the problem for me. Our room had everything we needed and was kept beautifully clean. "The Olive" Restaurant is just a magical place to be with wonderful food and a heavenly view. Ozlem deserves special mention. Such a friendly person who connected with everyone.Her advice was invaluable and her smile lit up the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situated!”
Reviews.Author: GentLinda
Reviews.Content: Dear Istanbul Fans This hotel is ideally located. Even from our room, we could see the Topkapi and the Agya Sophia. The roof terrace is beautiful. However, the happy hour system should be made more accessable and easier!!! The personnel at the hotel is very pleasant, to the point. Rooms are rather small but so clean! The bathroom is very well equiped with all the products we ladies like to use. This hotel is really recommended. On our next trip, we are going back! And also to the nice restaurants in the neighbourhood. A blessing to have a lot of choices when feet are hurting! Linda

Reviews.Title: “ozlem kadayifci”
Reviews.Author: rachel1082
Reviews.Content: had am amazing stay at the hotel everyone so nice and friendly. ozlem kadayifci was a amazing person to meet, gave me lots of advise and was always kind and friendly. i was visiting an ex boyfriend and ozlem gave me amazing advise, ;) also tock me and my family to have pictures in tradisanial turkish dress and had a fund time with her. also giving me advise on what to study at college and that i could study in turkey. fantastic person and quest officer. im my opinion ozlem should run all the hotels :D xxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in the best location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: kandt2010
Reviews.Content: We have been to Istanbul a number of times and would not stay anywhere else. The service is really good, all the staff are friendly and very helpful, especially Engin and Ozlem. The hotel is in an excellent location and very close to all the historic sights, if you don't feel like walking you can hop on the tram a few minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel also has a lovely rooftop restaurant where breakfast is served each day overlooking Istanbul and the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “the pleasures of IStanbul”
Reviews.Author: bassett163
Reviews.Content: Lots has been said about this hotel - ideal location, clean, friendly & helpful, smart, good fresh food, lovely restaurant - it is all true! We stayed for five nights to explore the main sights which are all minutes walk away. Five nights is plenty to explore the main sights and travel a little further afield. One thing to mention is that it is a little hilly, especially to the Grand bazzar and our other tip is to avoid the Grand Bazzar on a Saturday if you can as it heaves and you are swept through on a tide of people. We took a boat trip up the Bosphorus which you can pick up literally at the boat on the quay - you do not need an organised booking agent. There are various trips on offer detailed in various languages on signs held by the boat crews - we went for one that cruised up to the second bridge and returned without stopping. It took about one and a half hours and cost ten turkish lira each it was lovely and a way of freeing ourselves from the neverending stream of people that were enjoying their weekend in the sunshine. Although there are masses of people wherever you look they are very friendly, good mannered and very relaxed and it was a pleasure to walk anongst them and enjoy their city. Week days are significantly quieter and better suited for shopping and exploring the city streets. Must mention that around the corner from the hotel, on the tram street is a leather shop - Sumela - my husband bought a custom made leather jacket which was measured, cut and delivered in just 24hours and is of excellent quality and finish and reasonably priced, we cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Marni_Village
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the center of Instanbul with all the major sights at the walking distance with old-fashioned cozy rooms, pretty spacious for a city-hotel. We visited the spa and had a Turkish bath and peeling treatment, very enjoyable. The restaurant on top of the hotel offers a spectacular view and splendid service. The gourmet food there is really delicious and creative. All in all the hotel is a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, ideally located, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Erik1963
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. As a single traveller, I was concerned to pick a good hotel where I felt safe and was well located. I should not have worried - the Hotel Yasmak Sultan was ideal, indeed excellent. The staff were caring and helpful, the facilities were excellent and spotlessly clean. The food in the restaurant was first class and the views from the rooftop restaurant were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for the value & location”
Reviews.Author: StaceyK32655
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed @ this Hotel for 7 nights on a business trip. It was a great Hotel, centrally located and walking distance to almost everything. The tram is down the street (literally a minute away) The rooms are fairly small, but so are most of European hotel rooms. We stayed on the 1st floor, and it's been renovated. Clean room & bathroom ! Breakfast on the rooftop was truly excellent. I looked forward to this moment everyday, with the view and delicious variety of foods. Didn't eat any other meals at the restaurant. Got room service once and it was great. The staff was very helpful at all times. The front desk helped us with some shipping we had to do for our work and went out of their way. (thank you) Oslem was also very friendly & informative with our questions for getting around the city. Unfortunately we didn't have luck for using the Spa & the Turkish bath. By the time we would get back to the hotel and call the spa they were completely booked. You need to make an appointment from before!! Maybe next time when we are actually on a real vacation! Overall a great trip & stay. Turkish people are very hospitable, respectful and nice!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly well appointed hotel in the perfect position”
Reviews.Author: NeilB_11
Reviews.Content: Ozlem Kadayifci was the most outstanding Guest Relation Officer we have ever met in all the hotels we have stayed in through Europe. You do not have to seek her out as she comes to you with wonderful excursions, ideas and tips regarding Istanbul. The front desk and restaurant staff we also excellent. A most enjoyable stay. Neil Melbourne Australia

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming, quiet and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: sanctuarybay
Reviews.Content: Great location walking distance to everything, felt so much like home I ate in every night but one. Friendly personal service, especially Ozlem, clean, quiet and comfortable. Breakfast looking out over the rooftops was a great way to start the day and as you can spend so much time just walking around this unique exotic city, was an inviting and warm respite at the end of the day. As I was in Turkey for the Anzac Day memorial services at Gallipoli the tour meeting point was a 10 minute walk, I wasn't the only Australian in the hotel for the same reasons.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is pleasant in every respect”
Reviews.Author: robinvic
Reviews.Content: A bit like Istanbul itself. this hotel is without pretention, warm, giving and a thoroughly pleasant place to stay. While the rooms are a bit small and the decor is a bit dated it is very clean and staffed by great people. Breakfast is included in the tariff and is a generous and varied buffet held in a rooftop restaurant with great views of the blue mosque. The restaurant is great at night too. Unbeatable location, excelllent value

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond all expectations, again!!!”
Reviews.Author: barb031
Reviews.Content: This was our second family stay at the Yasmak Sultan (the first was 5 years ago). It was good enough then in our memories to plan to meet four other friends at the hotel for a week with much anticipation this time around, but it was even more wonderful than expected! Reservations (Tarik and Merve)- thank you- rooms were great and we appreciate your patience with the multiple and endless first minute, middle minute and last minute changes of reservation dates and arrival times for the four groups. By all means, have them send someone to the airport to pick you up! The restaurant was really tops (food and location). We had to tear ourselves away to occasionally eat somewhere else (thank you for your evening hospitality Alex). Breakfasts are amazing as described elsewhere. The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring Istanbul. The front desk is always ready to do and help with anything efficiently and with good humor (Ahmet and Orhan, especially). And then there is the incomparable Ozlem- our day planner, advisor and fairy godmother, who is there to make sure that everything you are looking for will actually happen in Istanbul, a magical city. Her official title is Guest Relations Director, but she starts out every morning at breakfast going table to table writing notes and directions for different groups with recommendations for activities, shopping and things not to miss during your day. As they say, priceless!! So thank you all, I will try the spa, which looks wonderful, next time, and would not stay anywhere else. We are hooked on the Yasmak Sultan!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nk333
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights with young children. Excellent location, easy walk to tourist attractions and shopping. Great selection of restaurants close by. Despite in the middle of old city the rooms were quite. Decent size rooms, good cleaning standard. To top it all the staff was amazing, very friendly and helpful. Ozlam (guest relation manager) was a gem, helped us to book tourist attractions and good advises for the places to visit and shop. I am already looking forward to visit again NK, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great guest services”
Reviews.Author: Cori_11
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Yasmak Sultan Hotel on our recent holiday in Istanbul. Lovely, friendly and helpful staff. Ozlem in hotel guest services went above and beyond recommending great city walking tours, shopping, restaurants and night life for us. All were perfectly suited to us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for short break”
Reviews.Author: R064
Reviews.Content: Yasmak Sultan is ideally placed for all the main sights. The staff are incredibly helpful. Breakfast in the roof top restaurant is the perfect start to the day. Ozlem (on the guest relations desk) provided us with many good tips for sightseeing to enable us to make the most of our short stay. She also advised us of restaurants that provided excellent local cuisine at very reasonable prices. We would happily stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “A second home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Penelope_754
Reviews.Content: When you travel with kids you need something more than a comfortable hotel. In Hotel Yasmak we found the hospitality one finds only in a friend's home. And although the staff was very professional, their politeness did not feel "professional" at all. We once again wish to thank for the hot soup brought to the room, after one of our toddlers fell asleep on the table of Olive Restaurant on the night of our arrival. Apart from that the rooms were comfortable and very clean, the location helped us to visit Aya Sofia, Top Capi Palace, the Spice Market and other monuments walking or using the tram and after that we could relax in the hotel's Hamam and Swimming Pool. We look forward to returning to Istanbul and Yasmak Sultan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A warm, freindly and perfect hotel for leisure travelling.”
Reviews.Author: irokovanko
Reviews.Content: We spend 6 days in Istanbul for a short vacation, my husband and me. We wanted a hotel with good location, ecxellent service, (a beatiful restaurant on top with a wonderful view) and a romantic but functual room with a romantic bathroom with BATHTOP. We slept well in very nice bed and loved our room. What surpized us was the service by the hotelquide Ozlam, who took care of our questions and needs the we we wanted. She made our stay much easier and made us consentrate on things that we wanted to do and see. Every morning she was there at breakfast and "made" our day successful! We highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star by any stretch of the imagination”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Really liked the local area, and proximity to main tourist sites, but the hotel itself was disapointing. Requested a twin room and received one bed and one divan. The latter was extremely uncomfortable. Sound proofing was non-existent so our quality of sleep was compromised. Breakfast served on the top floor; bright and airy room but the offerings left something to be desired. This room doubles as a bar and restaurant at night but there are nicer places around the corner. Staff were generally friendly and courteous but its a smallish hotel with few amenities in the public areas so you won't be lingering in the lobby. Istanbul such an interesting city, not at all what I expected!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly personnel and great view from the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Anya_KievKiev
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March 2011. The hotel is very nice and the location is perfect since all main sights are in the walking distance. It is also close to the tram station (but luckily you can not hear - it's really loud)). The personnel is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are nice and clean. Breakfast in the Olive restaurant was a perfect start of the day - the view is outstanding. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: 333Atina
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days in this hotel, had a great time relaxing after long days out, exploring Istanbul. Location, room, staff, restaurant and breakfast is without complaining. The only negative is hard beds. Would like to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: J_Lo76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days in February & I was pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel & the location were exactly as mentioned on the website, which is almost never the case. It is closer to all the major sights like the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Basilica Cistern & a short & pleasant walk away from the Grand Bazaar & Spice Bazaar. The Gulhane tram station is right outside the hotel which makes it extremely convenient to get to any of the other places you'd like to visit. The staff was very friendly & helpful & the breakfast was really nice. I'll stay there again whenever I go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “My wife & I had a wonderful time in Istanbul. It was the best experence of our lives.”
Reviews.Author: bluemousk
Reviews.Content: The hotel Yasmak Sultan where we stayed was excelent. The hotel staff could'nt do enough for us. We got to our hotel on Monday afternoon and after a few minutes we found the room was too small.We called reception and in few minutes we had a bigger room. The breakfast was some thing to die for. It was excelent. One day my wife was not feeling well and Ozlem guest relations at the hotel took my wife to chemist where she had her blood pressure taken and tablets priscribed.She was well in no time. The location of the holtel was very good & all amenities were very close.We loved it very much and will go back again. I

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: t1925
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location for touring old Istanbul. Two minutes walk to the tram stop to take you to all the sights you will want to see. Outstanding staff, friendly and very helpful. Most have a good command of the English language. Large assortment of food for breakfast and it is served on the top floor with a wonderful view. Rooms are normal size for European Hotels and very clean. We stayed in 510 and were very happy with it. The fitness center is first class with modern equipment. We took in the "Scrub & Foam" Turkish bath that the Hotel offers for 35 Euros and loved it. Wish we would have done it at the start of our stay so we could have done it again. MUST TRY the strawberry jam at breakfast. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sonietsjka
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and well maintained, breakfast is very elaborate and tasteful, the location is excellent but the best is the staff, who are all very friendly and professional. The excellent service almost turned our business trip into a holiday. Next time I have to be in Istanbul, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is just the right place to stay while beiing in Istanbul! See why - Family Zimmermann from Slovenia”
Reviews.Author: jan_zimmermann
Reviews.Content: we spent unforgetable last few days of the Year 2010 in Yasmak Sultan Hotel, a real jewell among lots of hotels in Sirkeci - is nice and clean, not too big and not too small, with very polite and serving staff - donÂ´t miss get known Mr. Engin! We cannot forget the room 507 - cousy, with mystic night view on Haghia Sofia. You must experience this breakfast on a spacey covered terrace with almost 360 degreas overwiew from Blue Mosque over Topkapi, Marmara Sea,Gold Horn with Taxim, towards Bosphorus Bridge and Black Sea. An in the evenings, until 9 o`clock, we enjoyed in Hamam, sauna and swimming pool dowstairs. Amazing. This is our second home in Istanbul, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with the most friendly personnel”
Reviews.Author: Olena S
Reviews.Content: The great price-quality ratio â€“ itâ€™s 100 per cent truth about this hotel! You wonâ€™t find super-modern design or freshly-made furniture in your room (but you donâ€™t need them if you walk through Istanbul from morning till night). But the friendly personnel and gorgeous location, together with the hotelâ€™s splendid roof-top restaurant, compensate everything! We recommend visiting the swimming pool every evening to relax after the hard day.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Glastonboy
Reviews.Content: We spent five wonderful days in Istanbul walking out each day from this superb hotel. The staff are excellent - observant and courteous. The breakfast, in the roof restaurant, is superb, a buffet of Turkish treats, such as cheeses, meats and olives, plus omelettes, cereals, fruit juices, honeycomb, and Turkish teas and coffees. The hotel is a short walk from the river, the Blue Mosque, the Cistern, and many other places worth seeing. At breakfast we met Ozlem, Gues Relations Rep, a truly charming and helpful woman who made very worthwhile suggestions about places to visit. We thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with very good service in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: kandt2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location with very good service and all amenities. Most historic sites are within walking distance of the hotel and a tram is 3 minutes walk away for anything that is not, or if you've walked your feet off. Our room was a junior suite, spacious with a view of the Hagia Sophia. There is a lovely roof top terrace restaurant (where breakfast is served each day) with views of the Bosphorous and Istanbul . We would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: re4mac
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time in Istanbul and Yasmak Sultan Hotel definitely assisted our experiences to be unforgettable. Thanks so very much.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable, that's what you are!”
Reviews.Author: sealady_11
Reviews.Content: Since our arrival, the personnel at Yasmak Sultan proved to be very kind, helpful and accommodating to every request of information and adjustment to our desires; the O'live Restaurant on top floor, allowing a 360Â° view of the enchanting city of Istanbul, is a plus where you are served breakfast in the morning: a glorious skyline, with a strong oriental and relaxing atmosphere; one can also enjoy dinner there, we did it twice and were very happy of our choice, comparing that restaurant with others located in the same historic quarter, the ratio between price and quality being excellent. One special feature of the hospitality at Yasmak Sultan is the caring and pleasant presence of Guest Relation Manager, Ozlem, whose warm greetings in the morning, as she passes through the breakfast tables, make every guest feel taken care of in a personalized way; just to mention an episode, as I was unfortunately suffering from a bad cold during my stay, she realized that and, spontaneously, without being asked, she prepared for me a hot beverage following a special recipe for cold and flu she had learned from her grandmother, an ancient and effective balmy drink, for which I'm still grateful to her. The cleaning of the room was impeccable, the wi-fi facilities very helpful and the relaxing moments spent on the roof terrace, with the company of seagulls and oriental domes, unforgettable. Definitely a hotel where we would like to come back to. Maria and Matthew

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time spent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dalik97
Reviews.Content: if you're going to Istanbul, I strongly recommend Yasmak Sultan Hotel. The hotel is so charming and cozy, the rooms are lovely and comfortable. The working personnel in the hotel is outstanding! Everyone is so responsive, polite and friendly! The hotel is also ideally located near all the cultural sights! majority of things I wanted to see in Istanbul such as Haya Sofia, basilicas and mosques were located very close to the hotel! Really recommend this wonderful hotel! D.A

Reviews.Title: “So home truths”
Reviews.Author: Hulk71
Reviews.Content: Left with a bad taste of the hotel within 10 mins of my arrival late Thursday evening. Have not remembered to get cash at the airport and going straight to the hotel. Reception were polite but having declined new years eve dinner at the hotel at a cost of â‚¬110 it felt as if the room they gave me was based on that choice plus with the porter trying to get a tip for pushing my very light hand luggage a mere 30 meters. Which I wouldn't give, he then refused to be polite or make any eye contact; however the location if the hotel was fantastic. With most things a short 10-15minute walk. Hotel was clean with a nice choice if newscast each day.

Reviews.Title: “The scenery is breathtaking!!!”
Reviews.Author: JGoldberg
Reviews.Content: i cant not say enough about yasmak sultan!i am a frequent traveller and this was my 4th time in istanbul.i have stayed in other sultanahmet hotels before and didnt have a good experience.After reading the reviews here i decided to stay there.The room was very comfortable and nicely designed, perfect for a female solo traveller like myself.The staff is just amazing they greet you when they see you always with smiles,which is a nice way to show that they care about the guests.They make you feel like you are home.The breakfast at the roof top Olive restaurant is extensive,wide variety of turkish cheeses and cold cuts,i especially liked the combed honey.The scenery is breathtaking,and the waiters are all very friendly.i also had dinner there and was very pleased.Hussein and Engin downstairs at the reception are very sweet and helpful.Last but not least Pr Oslem is shinning like sunshine every morning, she greets you every time she sees you and then gives the most valuable information on where to go, how to go and most importantly how to haggle!(which is was really helpful)special thanks to her.i would definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Comfort, Service - 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Akash58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Yasmak Sultan Hotel from 15th to 22nd Dec and would definitely wish to come back and stay at this classy 4*. It was superb value for money, comfort and location. But above all it gave us the people who are a credit to Yasmak Sultan Hotel and to Turkey. When staff take care of your every need, you know that you are staying at a hotel where customer service is regarded as paramount. The location is perfect for all that needs to be experienced. We loved the comfortabled bed and the spacious room. We were upgraded without asking. Room service was prompt and with a smile. We are fussy about clean hotel rooms and had absolutely no complaints about the daily cleaning service. We loved the breakfast with hot and cold choices and 360 degree views of Istanbul. I must commend Ozlem, a bright young customer relations officer at Yasmak Sultan. This young lady made our stay a pleasure. She would meet the guests during breakfast and gave the best unbiased advice. Without her, I think we probably would not have been to half the the places. Thanks Ozlem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, even Greater Service”
Reviews.Author: mcdaniel_scott
Reviews.Content: Normally stay with major brands on multiple business trips a year (Marriott, Hilton, Intecon, etc.) yet most of the hotels in the old city area of Istanbul are local.
