Searched around and found Yasmak, read many of the reviews, and choose this one for a short holiday in Istanbul. The hotel is perfectly situatied near all the attractions of the old city, all walking distance. The roms are good, a bit small, but it is the old city, yet very comfortable. The Olive restaurant has an amazing view and good food. However, the best aspect of our stay, by far, was the service provided by the staff, namely the client relations manager - Ozlem Kadayifci! She was extremely helpful and made our stay at this hotel go from very good to Excellent. I would definitely stay here again and next time will use the hotel turkish bath, great price with value offered compared to the touristy "famous" turkish baths...

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak has the extra touch you need to feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Kohs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the start of our trip and 1 more night after touring the west of turkey. My favourite 3 points about this hotel: 1. Location is terrific, you can literally walk to any of the famous spots like Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Arista Bazaar, Spice Bazaar. You get the gist. 2. Ms Ozlem, the guest relations manager has a wealth of knowledge that she shared with us, providing wonderful itineraries for days which we were on our own. She had some really good recommendations which were nice as they were less touristy. 3. Best breakfast during our 13 day trip in Turkey. This includes the quality of the food, the magnificent view (especially if you get to see the sunrise) and the lovely service staff who are warm and friendly. (Alex does a good freshly squeezed juice!) What I did not particularly enjoy was the Hammam. It is newly renovated, however there was some language barrier and thus I did not get to experience a fantastic Turkish bath.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations that we ever had.”
Reviews.Author: facethesun
Reviews.Content: The guest relation officer is warm, friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Heritage”
Reviews.Author: BasmaJamal
Reviews.Content: After experiencing the superb Metropol in Moscow, and now the even better close to Bosphorus, Istanbul establishment I suspect the Yasmak Sultan Hotel & subsidiaries sister hotels in the past occupies the (very) top of the 4+ stars (in my opinion could give 6+ stars) category. Staying there was more memorable than Ritz, Plaza, Lanesborough, Four Season etc and even put the Burj al Arab to shame for service. I booked a sweet room and was looks like upgraded to a super deluxe suite going in accordance with my budget price. The decor was very comfortable very close to to luxurious. This is intentionally a hotel where you must pay top dollar for really good views and relax. The spa (Turkish bath) is comprehensive, and has the biggest indoor hotel area I've ever seen. The food is also worth coming for (unfortunately priced in euros), especially as so many Istanbul restaurants are not of the highest quality themselves. But their biggest selling point is the famous staff courtesy; who remember your name and greet you anywhere they see you. The whole package is better than the sistersâ€™ branch. It is the best hotel in Turkey specially in providing all needed information and health help during my last summar visit. The staff is un questionable with culture and very good hospitality i.e. Mr. Engin, Mrs. Ozlem and othersâ€¦ Thank you very muchâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “I would strongly recommand Yasmak Sultan to my friends”
Reviews.Author: fly18
Reviews.Content: Location is great, close to all. Food & service are very good. The guest relations officer Ozlem Kadayifci is so nice & friendly, we got the most valuable information from her, include where to shop. Ask her before you explore the city.... I would strongly recommand this hotel to my friends....perhaps I will go back in near future.... --Jenny from New York

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay when visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: agelikigreece
Reviews.Content: Very good location, in the centre of the old city, with many of the top sights within walking distance. The staff is excellent and really helpful, special thanks to Ozlem, and the rooms are super clean and comfortable. Definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: strongbowfrance
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of thehistoric part of the city.It's within walking distance to the main landmarks and tourist attractions. As if that was not enough, there's a tramway station just a few meters down the streets that can literally take you wherever you wish . The staff is competent and as friendly as it is helpful. I particularly liked the service that was personal yet not overwhelming. The rooms aren't that big but nothing to be of concern. From the top floor the view is magnificent so it's a treat to have breakfast there. The olive restaurant restaurant is worth a try. Whether you're a couple on a romantic escapade or on family holiday, you'll undoubtedly enjoy a comfortable stay there. English spoken, as well as French by some employees.

Reviews.Title: “The Yasmak Sultan - a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Feathers9RAR
Reviews.Content: I have been to Istanbul on three occasions and this is the best accommodation I have had yet. The service from the staff was fantastic. The room though not the biggest, it was the cleanest in Istanbul. The location in the Sultanahmet area is every tourists dream. I must comment on Mustafa and his staff in the upstairs meal area, (Olive Restaurant) Hussein and the staff downstairs in the Sultania bar and restaurant. They were all excellent. The counter staff could not do enough for you. Last but not least was the Hotels Guest Relations Officer, Ozlem Kadayifi, she made this hotel our home away from home, a great asset to the hotel. We will definitely stay at the Yasmak on our next visit to Istanbul. The staff make the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at Yasmak”
Reviews.Author: loicouwehand
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at Istanbul and choose Yasmak for it's excellent location and good deal. But the friendly hotel staff really did the trick! At breakfast we got extra tips from the lovely manager, she made us feel very welcome! We also tried the just opened Hammam, brand new, very clean and stylish.

Reviews.Title: “decent choice”
Reviews.Author: elisagreece
Reviews.Content: very good location, close to major sightseeing, excellent service, friendly staff, excellent pr to wellcome u and guide u through your stay...very good breakfast, very very clean rooms-toilets, affordable and clean hammam services at the hotel compared to the ones in town.....really enjoyed staying there, would choose it again!

Reviews.Title: “Real quality and welcome at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: roxy047
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th stay at Yasmak Sultan, and again we brought with us a couple who are close friends but had never visited the Great City. The Hotel, which has always been excellent, is getting even better. We were first transferred to it due to overbooking in 2001 and have never used another since. The magnificently positioned restaurant, which commands views of the Golden Horn, the Bosphorous, Galata, Pera, Aghia Sophia, and the roofs of Topkapi has been completely refurbished since our last visit and the breakfast (always good) is now one of only 2 meals you will need in a day. Location in Istanbul is everything and one can walk easily to all the historic sights in the Old City and use the tram (stop 300 meters away) for journeys further afield. Eminonu and the ferries are a 10 minute walk away. This is the affordable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, relaxing oasis in busy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: solaraNewYork
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very good rooms and service. Concierge Ozlem provided exceptional assistance in arranging visit to Rahmi Koc Museum (don't miss it!). Say Hi to Ozlem for me if you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid location, super-friendly staff, great views during breakfast”
Reviews.Author: karuna007
Reviews.Content: Yasmak Sultan is a short walk to the major historic sites of Istanbul, and is surrounded by restaurants, trams to other neighborhoods, and enough shops to last a lifetime. The staff is remarkably kind and helpful; we think they all attended charm school. They serve up a substantial Turkish breakfast in their roof-top, glass-enclosed dining room with its views out over the Bosphorus. The double bedroom is rather small for more than a few days' stay; the suite is lovely but of course more costly. Everything was spotlessly clean and carefully managed. We would certainly return here should we be fortunate enough to visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for sighseeing Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bandung_10
Reviews.Content: When you are planning a holiday in Istanbul, this is the perfect place to stay. It is ideally located within easy walking distance of all the historical places. Our room on the backside of the hotel was a bit small but very quiet and comfortable and most importantly very clean. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and always made time to provide advises. Breakfast buffet was delightful and served in the rooftop restaurant with a beautiful view on Haghia Sophia where excellent food was served in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Line”
Reviews.Author: rajeshrohira
Reviews.Content: Functional, centrally located Hotel......Small compact rooms, for the price, clean toilets, walking distance to the trams, not that you would use thes too often. We had a conducted bus on call right through the 4 days in Istanbul - maybe therefore. Location is very central - walking distance for money changers, great local food joints, markets , convinience store for most things, except for liquor...... Taxis eaisily avalable through front desk 24 hours - Polite staff - Excellent terrace for breakfast buffet and some lovely Adana kebabs at night after a long day sightseeing - in Istanbul ( Cramped Elevator) Recommended for location / functionality / If you are on a purely sightseeing trip. NOT Recommended - If you are looking for a luxurious, comfortable laid back stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, lovely rooftop views and great service”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneTraveller10
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. The rooms aren't overly large but were comfortable. Hotel is well located - within easy walking distance to key attractions and very close to numerous restaurants. Nice touch was the ability to select a different pillow if you so desired (eg: latex, down etc).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: sassiestgal
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, perfectly located, great rooftop restaurant with views. Staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Muffty40
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice - right in the middle of all the tourist attractions namely the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and both the Spice Bazaar and the Grand Bazaar. Transport to and from Ataturk airport was punctual and very comfortable. The hotel staff were friendly, polite, helpful and courteous at all times. They all had an excellent knowledge of all the attractions, local restaurants and transport options. The rooms, although a little dated in their decor, were clean and the beds comfortable. Being typically English, the only thing we really missed was the hostess tray in the room - we love our early morning cuppa! The breakfast was extensive and plentiful and always had a good selection of food. We ate dinner in the Olive rooftop restaurant and enjoyed excellent food, service and value for money. The view overlooking the city was an added bonus. Alattin (Alex) was very attentive, helpful and friendly. We also ate dinner in the restaurant of the sister hotel, the Sultania where Huseyin made sure all was well with the food and service. Staff on the reception desk, especially Ahmed and Engin, were a source of valuable and seemingly limitless information! Would have no problems recommending this hotel to other travellers and would definitely stay there again if ever we returned to Istanbul. All in all the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul is a fascinating and exciting city - much to see and enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: Carina379
Reviews.Content: We chose the Yasmak Sultan mainly because of its location and the fact that they had a hammam (Turkish bath). When we got there, we were told that the hammam was under reconstruction - was a big disappointment for us. We went somewhere else and they contributed â‚¬10 per person (their charge for a hammam were it working). The location of the Yasmak Sultan is rather good, the rooms are a bit too small for two suitcases and cabin bags - difficult to move. When asked for a bigger room, we were shown a suite but that meant extra money and the suites were not very big. We have stayed in suites before in another country where they were really spacious. When requested, they were quick to give us another folding table to put our second suitcase which helped. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would particularly like to mention Engin and Hussain who were extremely helpful. The breakfast buffet was Turkish style buffet and adequate. We did not try the restaurant because there were several places in the surroundings where we could eat in. We were promptly picked up from the airport - free of charge. However, on the return journey, we had ordered a shuttle to take us to the airport for 16.30 as we had to be at the airport 2 hours before our departure to Europe. To our dismay when we had given up all hope of seeing the shuttle and I stressed that they would have to call us a taxi and pay for the fare, one of the staff members (I forget his name) went out and got his luxurious mini-bus and drove us in all haste to the airport. We appreciated this but it shouldn't have happened. Although we were late to arrive after schedule time, we were able to check-in. It kind of spoilt the trip to be so stressed in the end. The shuttle arrived almost half an hour late by which time we had decided to go with the kind staff member in his mini-bus. This sort of thing should be avoided. We will certainly return to Istanbul - one of my favourite cities!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: smlhi
Reviews.Content: Yasmak is in a very good location - central and within walking distance to all the sights of the old city. The staff, especially Engin Fison, gave us personalized service so that we felt like we were truly guests of honor. The rooms are nicely appointed, comfortable beds and great air conditioning. The breakfast buffet was amazing. We opted for a 5 day package that was well worth it. The hotel also arranged for tours that turned out fantastic. The hamburgers in the lounge were the best we've ever had. Wonderful view of the Bosphorus and the old city. We can't say enough about our visit to the Yasmak Sultan Hotel

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem right in the heart of Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: Roddek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yasmak Sultan Hotel for 4 nights on the way to Paris during the early part of August 2010. Here is a hidden gem right in the heart of Istanbul. I arrived at the hotel at 8am, and I was able to check in by 9am. Breakfast at this boutique hotel is excellent with a wide array of dishes to keep you going until late evening. The room that I was allocated was not large but quite adequate for a single person. The room was spotlessly clean and well serviced. The staff at this property bend over backwards to help you with any inquiry, whether it be shopping or booking tours or advising you on the tricky routes around Istanbul. Wifi is available in all rooms and works well. The rooftop terrace where meals are served makes a wonderful setting for dinner with supered views of the Sultan Amet(Blue Mosque) I would not hesitate to recommending the most discerning traveller to this wonderful, located property. Hope to stay at this hotel again in late August,

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time in Istanbul, thanks to hotel Yasmak Sultan.”
Reviews.Author: chretien_nadine
Reviews.Content: When we would return to Istanbul, we would certainly stay in hotel Yasmak Sultan again. Everything was very clean, we've got fresh towels every day and fresh bedlinnen after two days, SUPER. Everybody in the hotel was very helpful and polite. The breakfast was very good( what a vieuw on the roof at the blue mosk, the Aye Sophia, the Galatatower...) The hotel is situated next to all the historic buildings and the restaurants and shops. However, we slept very well and didn't hear any noise of outside. The room was very clean, but a little oldfashioned. That is the only "negative" thing we can say. ChrÃ©tien and Nadine from Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan is an absolute must!”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette18
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day stay at Yasmak Sultan. It's a splendid, affordable hotel that guarantees a good nights rest, followed by a very varied breakfast on the roof terrace, overlooking the Bosporus. Furthermore, the location is excellent: all sights are within walking distance. Yasmak Sultan? An absolute must!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and good location”
Reviews.Author: SARA111toronto
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very good - easy walking to many places and easy access to the tram to get the ferry. We travelled with 2 kids and all 4 stayed in one room. Even though the room is somewhat small as expected in old city the service from the hotel reception is excellent. Very helpful staff... will defintely reccommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Zia_2010
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were unbelievably friendly - at anytime of the day/night. The chocolate fugde cake dessert on the Olive restaurant (on the roof of the hotel) is to die for and a must for all chocolate lovers and the panaramic view from the restaurant is stunning!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: AshDoha
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a total of 5 nights, 2 nights first and then we left all our luggage and went to Cappadocia and came back to the Yasmak Sultan for another 3 nights, I have never experienced such accommodating staff, they were all so helpful and eager to please and went out of their way to help us, namely Ahmet, Husseyn at reception and Ozlem and Ciscem at guest relations. The hotel is situated in SultanAhmet so walking distance to visit the Blue mosque, Topkapi Palace, Ayia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar. Our room included breakfast and the service was excellent. We tried the olive restaurant one evening for dinner and it was superb. I highly recommend the Yasmak Sultan and would certainly stay there again on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outstanding service !!!”
Reviews.Author: sn102
Reviews.Content: Location : Great location!!! lots of places to eat nearby, walking distance! There is also a mcdonalds about 10 mins away! and all touristic areas are walking distance (blue mosque (10mins) bosphorus cruise and all ferries(15mins) Topkapi palace (5-10 mins) grand bazar 15 mins). If you want a taxi, the hotel will call one for you and it comes within 2 mins! In my opinion this is THE area to stay if you are visiting istanbul! (for those who are looking for night life, its near taksim square, and by taxi its about 10 TL), we didn't a see a lot of night life going on near sultanhamet! The tram stop is a 2 minute walk from the hotel (though we didnt use the tram at all! foot or taxi) Service : EXCELLENT service!!! i have rarely seen such nice and helpfull people! they had booked our train tickets in turkey for us, allowed early check in and late check out as soon as he rooms were ready, VERY accomodating wih all our requests (extra pillows...). they kept our suitcases for 2 days whilst we were not in istanbul. Room : outstanding view of the ayia sophia. AC working properly. good size bathroom. only thing that was missing was a proper quilt (they have like thick sheets on the bed). the free wifi in the rooms is an excellent service, though it doesnt always work that well Breakfast : not great! nothing with chocolate served, not a big variety of fruits. although for those who like a hot breakfast (eggs, cold meat, potatoes, tomatoes) you will be satisfied In all, GREAT HOTEL, i would definitely stay there again if i go back to istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is always a pleasure to come back to yasmak Sultan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunset71
Reviews.Content: Just came back from istanbul. As every visit to this charming city I have no regrets about staying in Yasmak Sultan. The hotel offers much more than well decorated rooms. Cleanliness is always present in the rooms and common areas, eating at the roof terrace restaurant is a pleasure not only in terms of quality of food it is also because the boys and girls make every effort to satisfy customers while eating there. From the restaurant is also possible to enjoy breathtaking views of the Bosphorus especially at sunset, in other words, it is to have a little of the huge Istanbul froin this small place. Service is a plus for this hotel, as explained in other occasions I have stayed in five stars hotels in Istanbul and always came back to Yasmak Sultan, the reason? SERVICE. In other places I have found luxury as a priority but I have realised that something is missing. In Yasmak Sultan you find a combination of everything, a cozy and trendy environment with the benefit of a high quality service, I can notice the effort made by every single person to make my stay comfortable. Apart from the regular facilities included such as a complete and delicious breakfast, free wifi, airport transfer in luxury cars and toiletries offered in rooms; if for any reason, you forgot razors, tooth paste, tooth brush, printing an important document, sewing a t-shirt at the last minute, ironing, etc, they provide an invaluable help, more importantly if they don't have something they go for it just to help customers. This is not only my personal experience is something that I have seen as provided to all clients. I seriously recommend Yasmak Sultan Hotel because it makes the difference when visiting a foreign place. My special gratitute to the manager of this wonderful hotel, and more especially to HÃ¼seyÄ±n, Engin, Ahmet, Mezut and Orhan for their kindness and extraordinary support.

Reviews.Title: “Just speldid!”
Reviews.Author: anastasiabAthens
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful... The staff is friendly and professional (especialy Gust Relations), the breakfast so delicious, the rooms verry clean and the location perfect. It is so close to everything. If i ever be in Instabul for sure i will stay again in Yasmak Sulatan.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Mcknight11
Reviews.Content: The Yasmak ia a great simple place for a small business trip. Right next to the Sigercei Station. Not posh or modern but Plush with a soft interior of a 'Yesterdays Mens club society. The buffet breakfast is great with w wonderful city sky line. The top balconey gives a terrific view of the Blue Mosque. If your traveling alone not demanding the royal carpet this is a great place to stay. My shirt came back having shrunk smaller than before but I don't know who to blame for that. The Staff were most accomodating. My company upgraded me to the deluxe/ Jr.Suite as the standard size rooms are a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: rayc101
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful. Decor authentic. Room was comfortable despite noise from airconditioners outside window. Nice bathroom with good shower - plenty of hot water. Rooftop restaurant fabulous and had beautiful food (especially the Turkish breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: RonaldvanderBoom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Sultanahmet, which has the charms of being a bit removed from the insanity of Istanbul, which made it a great spot for us. The rooms are outfitted with every new thing you could ask for, from beautiful art, lush furniture and sparkly bathroom fittings. The staff are wonderful, and looked out for our every need, giving us advice on travel and making sure that our food was just as we wanted it. Enjoy the luxuries of excellent food and wine on the rooftop restaurant while admiring the breathtaking view of the Bosporus and the spectacular Istanbul skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at home”
Reviews.Author: mumsholidaySydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 83 year old mother in law for 4 days at this hotel and we felt very welcome.The staff were very helpful and kind especially when my mother in law became unwell providing a car and escort to the airport. The hotels position was great overlooking the sea and mosques. We felt safe walking around the old town, botanical gardens and shops which are close by. Treat yourself to the Turkish spa ,best massage and lots of fun. I would stay here again in a heartbeat., and would recommend it highly to older travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Hotel on Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: radamspse
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Yasmak for a period of 5 days over two separate visits. On both occasions the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The room for the first visit was a standard room and offered sufficient space and all the expected amenities, on the second visit we were upgraded to a suite and I must say for central Istanbul there was so much space within the room we felt like we where in the Topkapi palace. It certainly made the the stay very enjoyable. We didn't ask for the upgrade, the staff just offered it gratis because they could, that I like! The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The roof top bar restaurant was nice and the breakfast offered more than enough choice. The only down side was that the Turkish bath/sauna was out of order when during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: spatel5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at your Hotel from May 30 to June 03, 2010 (four nights). The staff of Yasmak Sultan was very co-operative and helpful. Their guidance helped to make our visit to Istanbul and other part of Turkey very comfortable and enjoyable. Hotel The breakfast menu was very good and the items were fresh and of good quality. The roof top restaurant is clean and has very good view of the bay. One more thing they offer 7% discount on cash payment of the room price which we availed.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in THE Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Rich080
Reviews.Content: This Hotel, the Yasmak Sultan, did everything right. The service was right there all the time. The wi-fi was fast and free. The food in their restaurant was the best I found on the whole trip. And, their location, in the heart of the old city let you wander through alleys filled with restaurants, hooka bars, and small stores without ever having to leave the neighborhood. It is also within walking distance of some of the major Mosques, Parks and Palaces. I gave it the highest rating would would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: AntwerpGuyke
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is nearly perfect: just round the corner of the most important places to visit in Istanbul. And the hotel itself is good maintained, friendly staff, good restaurant with a splendid view. Lots of other pleasant restaurants and bars just within meters of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed, good value hotel with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: JLW000
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to top attractions, hotel "Olive' restaurant good with a great view. Rooms clean and adequate though small - suggest a junior suite. The staff are exceptional. Helpful in every possible way. Only downside is poor wifi. Apple iPhone's are not supported - only the Safari browser will work.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with very friendly, helpful staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: aandtn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice and would definitely recommend it. A great location, in walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, Tokapi Palace etc. Nice room, great service by friendly, helpful staff. Fantastic view from rooftop restaurant and buffet breakfast was delicious! Anne from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: Adelitadriana
Reviews.Content: we had a good holiday and we experienced lots of things.. it was nice to visit Istanbul and stayed in Yasmak Sultan Hotel.. All the conditions were very good.. And we could see lots of places for the location. The foods were very delicious.. It will be very nice to visit there again..

Reviews.Title: “the friendliness from the all staff and the way they took care of us”
Reviews.Author: synna
Reviews.Content: very good location in Instanbul central to many sites in the old town not far from shopping area like the old bazaar and the egyptian bazaar the location was not noisy inspite the central location restaurant on the roof with good view to the golden horn excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Lasse_Pedersen
Reviews.Content: Very nicely situated in Sultanahmet, with walking distance to lots of sights, the Topkapi Palace, the Blue mosque, the Grand Bazar, etc. etc. The hotel is clean and tidy, has a roof restaurant with a fantastic view over the strait of Bosporous, and a very nice and friendly staff. We were caught by the eruption of that Islandic volcano, and our plane home was cancelled. The hotel has a "guest relations officer", a very competent, and also very nice, young lady, miss. YÃ¼ksel, who made sure our flightreservations were kept active, and with her assistance, we made it home as soon as the ashcloud had lifted from our hometown. A memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Ottavian
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Istanbul. Stayed in Yasmak Sultan for four nights. Really good hotel: excellent location and great service. Two examples: The first, I had a problem with WiFi in my room. A person from the reception went immediately to my room and helped me to set up the connection. The second one: We needed to print our boarding passes a night before our flight out. Short phone to the reception and problem solved. They asked me to email boarding passes downstairs and bingo--after few minutes I had boarding passes printed. It is clear that the crew of this hotel is service oriented. I highly recommend this hotel and I agree with all previous comments and reviews published here.

Reviews.Title: “A pearl in the crown of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Yasmak28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Yasmak Sultan during the Icelandic ashcloud. The staff did a tremendous job to help us, especially Cisem Yuksel was very helpfull! I would recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to vist Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_R_Watson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights and it was the best experience in a 4 star hotel. The staff were very helpful and Cisem yuksel (guest relations lady) was awesome at helping us out at pointing us out in the right direction to shopping malls, tourist spots and all the rest. Oh and the olive restaurant up stairs has really Good breakfasts and meals at night so don't miss out on those. The cruises and trips around turkey are worth going on :)! Will be back in the near future, I hope :)

Reviews.Title: “An Athmosphere Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElodieBrussels
Reviews.Content: The location was great. No need to mess up with crowded busses or trams to visit the main attractions. So that was very handy. Staff was sincerely helpful. The hotel overall was very very clean.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: miekielib
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the main stream hotels (Sheraton, Intercontinental, Hyatt, etc.) when I travel overseas. For this trip I wanted to stay in the older part of town as I feel the main stream hotels proivide such a standardised offering that one rarely gets the feel for the local culture. I was recommended by my travel agent to use the Yasmak Sultan in Istanbul and what a pleasure it was! The restaurant on the top floor has one of the best views, the food is excellent, breakfast is fantastic, but the true Turkish hospitality is what won me over. The room was comfortable and quiet and the value for money was fantastic. Everything worked, everything was clean and it felt like a home away from home. Cannot wait for the renovations to the bath house to be completed - I will most certainly be back since Istanbul is a dream destination for both me and my partner.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in oldtown”
Reviews.Author: tgytzc
Reviews.Content: Yasmak Sultan is in Eminonu, very close to Hagi Sophia, Grand Bazaar, Taksim.. Location is perfect for all the major tourist sites. You can walk to all these sites with no effort. Hotel has a restourant at the rooftop, its name is Olive. You can see the golden horn and Ottoman Palace at the same place when you enjoy your meal. The staff are very friendly. Thanks Ms. Yuksel for a daily newsletter giving information on local weather, events, and places of interest. This was accompanied by personal enquiry during breakfast into our stay and service. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone, you won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “a social en pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: huubenmarian
Reviews.Content: when we came in there were a lot of helping people of the hotel. they not only dit it for money. The rooms were clean and were kept clean during our hollidays. The lady Cisem Yuksel have given us a lot of advises about the things we have to see in Istanbul. and she also asked the day after if every thing had gone ok. we have had a verry pleasant recidance. in the yasmak sultan hotel. Huub en Marian Joosten

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel i ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: pratsomme
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling allot and will say this is one of the best hotel I ever stayed at. Everything was great and the service was excellent. The reception boss even used his day of to give us a sightseeing in the town, when the guide cancelled. We were four middle age guys staying 4 nights and we had a great time. Will recommend strongly if you are going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: Pelagius_Redivivus
Reviews.Content: The Yamak Sultan Hotel is very conveniently situated, within easy walking distance to Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Hippodrome, but yet in a quiet street. The roof-top restaurant was excellent, with amazing views over the city, and there was nearby access to other eating places when we wanted to dine out. We had all the facilities that we needed, including free wifi access, and the staff went out of their way to help us - friendly and efficient. They made problem-free arrangements for trips and transport to our next destination. We would definitely use this hotel again. Many thanks to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Tomppa68
Reviews.Content: Service was good, personel was willing to help. Great view from breakfast room over city to Bosbor bay and asia. Location was exellent in old town, many targets of sightseeing within walkable distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything + solving problems!”
Reviews.Author: mjk69
Reviews.Content: Lost my bag in another restaurant and they got it back ...this is top-service that you don't always find! I would have recommended this hotel also without this extra-service: Great location close to main attractions, friendly stuff, great restaurant at the roof, good room. Don't know the price - should NOT be cheap ;) Easy & safe choice!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: hassan_ibrahim20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yasmak Sultan based on a recommendation by a friend - and boy were we impressed! Every single staff member was really nice, polite and helpful. The staff recommended amnities that were always good - they also sorted out are shuttle return, river tour and sofi show (all with hotel pick ups). The food at the olive restaurant was fantastic - only bettered by the views of the aya sophia and istanbul. The room we stayed in was clean, comfortable and of a good size. everything was within walking distance, the aya sophia, blue mosque bath of lady herrum, cistern basilica and hippodrome were within a 2 minute walk. the grand bazzar was a 5 minute walk and the spice bazzar was about a 10-20 minute walk - however, i recommend you take the tram (20 meters outside the hotel) cause it will get you there in a couple of minutes. I would recommend to anyone to stay at this hotel - and for sure we will be staying there anytime we go to istanbul! Hassan and Karen

Reviews.Title: “we would recommend this hotel to anyone we know”
Reviews.Author: beestel
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on a BA inclusive holiday deal. The hotel is centrally located and for the city break tourist, its proximity to all the "must see" sights is a real benefit. It is situated just off the main tram route but is quiet and peaceful. Staff were excellent -helpful and very friendly. The 6th floor dining room provides not only a fulsome breakfast but also terrific city views.The dinner menu was fairly priced and catered for all tastes -we dined there twice in our 4 nights stay. We were there in February so the terrace bar was not open but I imagine it would be an excellent place for a drink in (slightly) warmer weather. Our room was of good size, bathroom likewise and generally all in good order. No hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Flexible attitude”
Reviews.Author: EricTurku
Reviews.Content: Middle size, homy hotel located near targets worth of seeing in Istanbul. Splendid view from the roof restaurant over the city. Flexible and friendly service. The relation of price level and the quality of hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with beautiful roomtop- views”
Reviews.Author: StefanAnn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Yasmak Sultan between 14-18 feb 2010. The hotel is ideally located in old Istanbul, at walking distance of the Aya Sofia. The hotel has had some recent renovation: the Olive-restaurant with rooftop terrace offers an excellent view over the town. The staff is very friendly (espec. the waiters in the restaurant) Reception and bar downstairs are a bit outdated. Rooms are small but nice and clean. We booked a room on the 4th floor, and didn't hear any streetnoice.We enjoyed real fine dinings at the Olive Restaurant- the fish in saltcrust was super! (too bad the life-music for the Valentines-meal was so extremely loud - and so were the cheers from some groups of visitors...it weakened our romantic feeling) Breakfast is nice (buffet). It would surely be appreciated if they would offer free wireless internet (now only a paying "Internet-cafÃ©" (table with one PC)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: apolt21
Reviews.Content: this hotel newone i liked it i liked there i am serious you should see.espacial you should taste dinner you can see istanbul of historical thank you for everythink and i remember ibrahim he was server good friend he was hardworking thank you yasmak hotel

Reviews.Title: “It was a good place to stay in Turkey.”
Reviews.Author: Williamjones4
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband for my honeymoon. People who works there were very friendly and kind. Food and location was very good. While we stayed there staff Orhan Acar helped us.

Reviews.Title: “beautifull breakfast and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Romario11
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay here a beatful hotel with a wonderfull staff. the breakfast at the rooftop was also very nice we had a wonderfull time here ! thank you orhan acar for help us

Reviews.Title: “good locatÄ±on”
Reviews.Author: MoskowNataliyaMoskow
Reviews.Content: Firendly and helpfull staff clena room delicous breakfast. They are serving free tea. The hotel located en very good are whÄ±ch Ä±s close by the main historical sites. Thanks mesut and all front of desk staff

Reviews.Title: “A JEWEL IN SULTANAHMET”
Reviews.Author: Sunset71
Reviews.Content: I have been in Istanbul for both business and holiday trips in several occasions. I have no words to describe the pleasure and comfort when staying in Yasmak Sultan Hotel. Apart from being a cozy hotel with the highest standard in terms of cleanliness, location and price; I would like to emphasize the outstanding service provided by its employees. During my visits to this beautiful city, I have had the opportunity to stay in different hotels, including five stars hotels. Although the latter can be considered as offering luxurious spaces, there is something missing: 'the top service and welcoming environment that I have only found in Yasmak Sultan Hotel'. The effectiveness and attention given to every single detail makes the difference with respect to other hotels around the city. If you need something, whatever it is, they just come along to help you. You can simply feel like at home!!! This time I has been surprised with a gorgeous and modern renewed restaurant in the roof terrace. Although from there it was always possible to enjoy the wonderful views to the sea (from one side) and the Blue Mosque (from the other side), now it is even better because of the beauty of the new restaurant and breakfast room, with its modern seats in a minimalist style, clear colours and big screen TV for those interested in it. The restaurant has been refurbished at the top level and I can only say that It's simply amazing! You are not going to regret a stay in this special and beautiful hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “My best experience”
Reviews.Author: celen
Reviews.Content: I have been yasmak sultan twÄ±ce.specÄ±ally thanks to front desk for worth servÄ±ce.I came fÄ±rst novembre terrace restaurant vÄ±ew wonderfull.you can do breakfast wÄ±th bosphorus vÄ±ew.when we arrÄ±ve jan. restaurant closed for renovatÄ±on.we talked front offÄ±ce manager as hÄ±m saÄ±d renovatÄ±on wÄ±ll fÄ±nÄ±sh mÄ±ddle jan.thanks .....

Reviews.Title: “hello Ä°STANBUL”
Reviews.Author: camelot7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Yasmak Sultan is located at one of the most beautiful corners of Istanbul. In the historic district of Eminonu, it's a few minutes from Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque which are at the cradle civilizations. Its terrace restaurant is perfect for a quite dinner with an unmatched scene of the Bosphorus and Golden HornWe also want to thank all the personelle of Yasmak Sultan hotel for such a good service and especially MANAGER Eda and Ahmet who helped us at the reseption.See you again.

Reviews.Title: “good location helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: snaiper35
Reviews.Content: all about this hotel was so wonderfull cant say anything more many thanks for front desk for their kindness :)

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel .perfect person.staff”
Reviews.Author: jackverde
Reviews.Content: Ä± was wery happy in this hotel Ä±spend very good time.it was very near to the topkapi place and good where.Ä± want to thank you for kind staff .specchly front ofice ahmet .about for him recomandations..

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: meternik
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was really great and we would definetly recommend this hotel. The staff was excellent. The room was very clean and comfortable and wonderfull delicous foods with excellent service. We spent 3 nights in this hotel and this was an unforgettable experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “I'll book it again”
Reviews.Author: LasseT
Reviews.Content: Good location, peaceful area close to most main sights. Great view from roof top restaurant/breakfast room ovett the city and Golden Horn. Friendly staff, clean rooms. Only con was very slow/not working wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay at the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzeeSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Yasmak Sultan Hotel. Al the staff members were extremely helpful, friendly and ready to accomodate your needs. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the breakfast was top quality. I can recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit the old part of Istanbul and I will definately stay there again. The location is perfect. Its surrounded by good restaurants and hostorical sights within walking distance. The hotel also arranges day tours which was great. I love it there and i love the people there.

Reviews.Title: “A right place to stay and to explore Istanbul from its exciting faces”
Reviews.Author: mobius_sunfire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the center of many historical buildings like Sultan Ahmet Camii, Hagia Sofia Camii, Yerebatan Cisternes, the Topkapi Palace and many others. The service in the hotel is great and the guests get a helpful hand in organising their daily program through the realy well informed receptionists (Thanks to HÃ¼seyin Kepceoglu and his team). Congratulations and a big Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying and money spended on yasmaksultan.”
Reviews.Author: MARD1974
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by my friend. This 4 star hotel is a good value for money. Very centrally located, all major historical spots, restaurants, shops, tram station etc were at walking distance saving on transportation. They served very lavish, wide varieties, satisfactory breakfast (until 11am) and diners with good food presentation and slide shows on istanbul. All Staffs from receptionist to other service staffs were always smiling, very helpful, spoke english well, gave us the right guidance and honest views, always making sure our stay is confortable. Double bed room was descent size with good bathroom & wifi facilities. View was not important for us and we were happy with room to be away from the semi-main road to avoid little traffic noise (acceptable in sultanahmet area). Initially we only booked for 5 nights but later we extended our stay for 3 more nights on enjoying the hotel's hospitality. My wife felt ill during last couple of days and they upgraded to suit room with wonderful view of hagia sofia at no extra cost. On our request they arrange a good private hospital treatment & transport. My 5 yr old son felt very comfortable in this hotel and got friendly with all staffs. They offer a seperate bedding for my son at no extra cost. We are missing everything about this hotel and shall certainly go back to the same. It has got a good turkish bath and sauna facilities. Gym could be better but who cares to be fit on holiday. Due to refurbishment work on terrace restaurant we missed to enjoy panaromic city & sea views from terrace. We didn't repent of being ill as we felt at home and worth every penny & time spent during our stay at Yasmaksultan. Availability of prayer mate, beads, qibla sign, wifi, toilet kit, drinks on fridge(to be paid) as standard was a sign of concerns of every needs of guests. Definately recommend to everybody. Suit room is worth staying for little extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: ValenciaLatin_girl
Reviews.Content: very comfortable hotel and friendly staff. I enjoyed my stay at the city, and the staff, specially mesut gave me some tips to visit the city. I will recommend to my friends in their next travel to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay with good hospitality, a lot of fun and a great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: DavidKranenburg
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our two sons (15 and 19 years) with rooms next to each other. We liked Istanbul very much. In the hotel was the turkish Sauna treatment, after a day in the city, great for my sons and me!

Reviews.Title: “We'll go back next year”
Reviews.Author: Levent34
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at Yasmak Sultan. Entered the hotel and received a friendly and smiling welcome. Able to get early check-in about 30 minutes before standard check-in. The room was spotless and the warm color palette was inviting. I absolutely loved the padded window seats and cozied up there both nights of my stay - with the bolster pillow, the beautiful and soft throw, a book, and my camera. Orhan at the front desk Rocks!!

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated for tourists, excellent ratio quality price, very kind personnel;”
Reviews.Author: Puju
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here - all people were very kind and polite; the hotel is very close to important touristic objectives; also a very quite and copnfortable hotel, ideal for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “It was an Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Boneville
Reviews.Content: The accommodations were wonderful. Food was great. Service was prompt and courteous. Rooms were clean. My kids had a wonderful time. We could not have asked for anything better. Excellent recommendations by front desk especially by Orhan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a good location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Expat_Aggie
Reviews.Content: The Yasmak Sultan Hotel is literally a stones throw from Topaki palace and a short walk to every other major attraction in Istanbul. While a small part this does mean a lot as the logistics of getting from point a to point b cease to matter. When we checked in, was when we remembered that we booked a room for a brother that cancelled on us. Normal hotels will get you for that night and maybe the next nigth, but they just cancelled it no charge. Also they did not have a king bed room so they upgraded us to the suite for the day that turned into 4 full days. Also my parents wanted to change rooms which they were able to do the next day. Overall this has been very accommodating. The hotel itself is on a rather busy road where we do hear some of the traffic, but my family in another room doesn't hear it. The rooms are nice and clean with basic amenities and if you forget something then they can probably provide it for you. The bar is small and quiet which is nice for drinks with the family, but there is a better bar 50 meters away if you are inclined. Finally the food for breakfast is complimentary which in the states mean toast and a little butter. But here it is a full course breakfast that is actually better than the pay buffets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: ATLANTIAN99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October. Location is very convenient, staff was very friendly and helpful. Ahmet at the Front Desk was very knowledable about the local attractions and her recommendations saved us time and helped us enjoy our trip even more.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly efficient service”
Reviews.Author: mrdostmohamed
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife took a trip recently to Istanbul and opted for the Yasmak for it's central location prior to the trip. On arriving at the airport the meet and greet service was there to take us to the Yasmak, so there was no waiting around to get to our hotel. On arrival at the hotel the service from the reception area to our room was first class .Nothing seemed too much trouble for any of the staff at the hotel and Engin the reception clerk was most helpful. If you want a hotel that's in a central location in Istanbul that is within walking distance of the the historical/tourist places, and a hotel with friendly/informative staff then you can do no wrong the in making the Yasmak your choice in Instanbul. Another added bonus of choosing the Yasmak is if you want to venture further afield then the trams run directly outside the hotel, don't let this put you of from staying at this hotel as you are not interrupted by any outside noise what so ever. Mr Dostmohamed UK

Reviews.Title: “It is absulately a fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth1292003
Reviews.Content: We stayed in that beautiful hotel for four nights. People, who work there, are so hospitable we were treated with high quality of service from first night until last night. The hotel's location was great, it was very central to all other attractive places such as the blue mosque, and grand bazar. Were told that it is more convenient to travel by tramway with akbil as it is much easier. Ahmet also gave us very good ideas about other istanbul's attractive places. I would like to thank Ahmet for his help. The breakfast was so delicious. When we went to our bedroom first time, the little surprise, whic was organised by the hotel, was so nice. I would like to recommend the hotel to every one the quality of service was worth of every single penny that we payed. The rooms were clean and fresh.We had a trip through the Bosporus by a boat. Istanbul is the most beatiful city that I have ever seen in my life. the city is so historical.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent location, a unique hotel, warm welcoming and very friendly staff"”
Reviews.Author: Jessica_Mccorby
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. It takes 5-10 minutes to The Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Santa Sophia and other sights by walk. The room was very nice also clean. A late check-out was not a problem and the transfer from the hotel to the airport was very easy. The breakfast buffet was very good, offered both European and local dishes. The staff was very helpfull especially Ahmet and Mustafa from the front desk and Ziya from the restaurant. We will certainly be back and we would like to thank all the staff =)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: pascha1982
Reviews.Content: if you want to think about istanbul leisure I think you should choose yasmak hotel. it is really good service exellent and very good turkish hospitality you can find there also location is in the center of istanbul (sultan ahmet). I want to say thanks to my good receptionist orhan he was so helpfull. thank you all

Reviews.Title: “It was great to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Patricijaes
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Yasmak Sultan Hotel for 4 nights. There was a free airport pick up and a kind driver, the room was very clean and with very, very fast internet access. i could work there with no problem. The hotel is located i the old city, so the Grand bazar and Blue Mosk and other turistic places are very close. Also there`s a tram station very close. I vas advised to take a city tour which was in a good quality. There`s a free breakfast - big assortment, i was very happy. The stuff speaks very good English. This is one of the best hotels i have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you so much!!!”
Reviews.Author: tearose66
Reviews.Content: If you have trouble looking for a good hotel to stay in Istanbul, Yamak Sultan Hotel would be the answer. It's not a big household name...but the hospitality, the service, the staff especially...is FIRST CLASS! Worth every cent spent.... (we stayed there for 5 nights and not a single day to regret) Ayoib and wife Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic breakfast lounge, pretty correct rooms, reliable staff.”
Reviews.Author: magicpowder
Reviews.Content: I want to remark, that the title of my comment is very accurate. I believe Yasmak Hotel offers the best quality price relationship in Sultanahmet. Many other hotels fail to meet my requirements because they have tiny rooms or breakfast in the basement. Yasmak offers clean rooms, reliable employees, fantastic view over Bosphorus and Taksim while having breakfast or dinning.

Reviews.Title: “Good service - good value for money - great view from top floor restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Orienteererdane
Reviews.Content: The Yasmak Sultan was the host hotel for the Istanbul 5 Days orienteering event. I stayed there with a group of 12 other Danes, and we all liked it. The hotel is right in the centre of all the big attractions: Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Water Cistern, Topkapi Palace and has spacious, well-maintained rooms - minibar, good bathroom, air conditioner that only whispered occasionally while doing its job. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet had fresh, good-quality products. Despite these qualities, the hotel is only medium price-ranged. We intend to use it again when returning to next year's race in Istanbul. However, the best thing about the Yasmak Sultan is the view from the top floor restaurant. Hagia Sofia, the rest of the Golden Horn, the sea... Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: dallachy
Reviews.Content: I had the great pleasure of staying a second time at the Yasmak Sultan in September this year. Perhaps the room and bathroom are a little on the smallish side but in no way does that detract from how comfortable the hotel is. The staff from reception through to the restaurant and cleaning, without fail are amongst the warmest and most obliging I have dealt with during my travels over the years, nothing was ever too much trouble for them. And as for the hotel location, what more could anyone ask for - just minutes from so much of what Istanbul has to offer (and it's hard to top having Hagia Sofia as the backdrop to your breakfast on the terrace !) . The Yasmak Sultan really did feel like a 'home away from home' and for such a comfortable, well located hotel, very good value. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the best parts of Old Istanbul - with many excellent features”
Reviews.Author: narkabunda
Reviews.Content: We had a de luxe room - spacious, all mod cons and good bathroom facilities. It overlooked a busy street but this was not disruptive at night. Our room was kept scrupulously clean. The roof restaurant has superb views over the Bosphorus, towards Top Kapi and Haghia Sophia ; it offers a plentiful, varied breakfast to suit all tastes - but the comb of honey is a treat - and the same restaurant, the Olive, offers a good menu for dinner .......to enjoy with the lights over the Bosphorus. All staff are friendly. English language skills are improving all the time. Wi-fi throughout the hotel. Sauna and fitness facilities not tried - too busy! We had a happy stay despite miserable wet chilly weather.

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan Hotel...we would go again tomorrow.”
Reviews.Author: joynsteveWirral
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with our 2 grownup daughters stayed for 4 nights. Rooms were fine and tucked at end of corridor. All staff friendly and helpful. Super roof terrace for breakfast evening meal or just drinks ...amazing views. We ate there on our first night and it was good, also nice to come home to after sightseeing. The hotel is in a quiet position but near to all main sights ( walking distance ) There is a handy tram stop too. Plenty of places to eat locally. Istanbul felt very safe and we all enjoyed it. The Archeological museum is AMAZING for the exhibits many of which are in pristine condition. We had no hassle from vendors.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable well-positioned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan052
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay in a Hotel that is beautifully calm in a noisy bustly City. The Hotel staff were so pleaseant and helpful, eg. suggesting a cheaper option than the taxi we were ordering to return to the Airport. Breakfast was plentiful with good choice.The position was perfect for us - central, within a few minutes walk to Topkapi Palace (uphill when you get within the walls) Blue Mosque and Aghia Sofia and just a feww minutes around the corner for a selection of restaurants offering tourist menus and a la carte menus. A really enjoyable 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great dining with relaxed family friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Skye70
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Yasmak Sultan and would definitely stay there again. We had a lovely corner room with our own view of Hagia Sophia from the corner window. But, our favorite place was the roof restaurant and buffet... the food was authentic Turkish and excellent... to wake up each morning and see nearly 360 degree skyline views of Istanbul while relaxing over breakfast was an amazing experience. The kids particularly liked the breakfast buffet with the real honeycomb as a special treat. On our last night we had the chefs signature baked fish... which was delicious... best food we had in Turkey. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Expect a 3-star , good hotel”
Reviews.Author: heleneLondon
Reviews.Content: Expect a 3star hotel and you wont be disappointed Expect a 4star like I did and you will definitely be disappointed I would still recommend you stay here only because the location is fantastic..all attractions are within walking distance 5-10 min MAX. The tram is right outside if you need to go any further , example to Modern Istanbul or to Grand Bazaar (if you dont want to get lost walking to it) Some of the things I did like, MINIBAR menu was confusing - QTY 2, PRICE 6 Liras, makes you think they charge 6 liras for 2 bottles, when infact the charge is per bottle No complimentary fruits were provided as claimed on the website Airport pickup is only from ATATURK airport and not from Sabiha airport Bathroom lock broken Room safe was loosely placed in the cupboard and didnt seem very secure Toileteries were not upto a 4star standard Things I liked: Excellent location Excellent service and hospitality Excellent restaurant / excellent breakfast - lots of options reasonable room rates

Reviews.Title: “Great location,comfortable,clean & value for money”
Reviews.Author: Derya_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Yasmak Sultan recently and loved it. We had stayed at other Sirkeci & Sultan Ahmet hotels before but none compare to the luxury, comfort and great service you will receive at Yasmak Sultan. Its only a hop skip and jump from the main attractions such as Aya Sophia Museum, Topkapi Palace, Istanbul Archeology Museum, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, Bosphorus Cruise, Blue Mosque and much more are all within comfortable walking distance. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly, the breakfast on the Terrace was wonderful, great variety and great views. Our room was a good size, clean, comfortable. Lots of room to move around, great decor and lighting. Bathroom was good size, clean also. All round great hotel and value for money. We will definately choose Yasmak Sultan for our future travels to Istanbul. I highly recommend Yasmak Sultan. We travelled all around Turkey in September for 4 weeks and this was our favorite hotel. Derya & Vince Galati -Australia

Reviews.Title: “What more could one ask for!”
Reviews.Author: vansydney
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel right in the middle of everything one needs - shopping, culture, restaurants catering for all pockets. We are two 'young' 60 yr old girlfriends who decided to have a holiday that we had planned 20 years ago. Stayed at the Yasmak Sultan for two nights then left on a 10 day tour of Turkey whilst leaving our luggage at the Yasmak for only one lira/night each. Upon our return the separate rooms we had requested were ready for us and we were shown to them immediately. The entire staff we extremely welcoming and helpful i.e. reception, housekeeping, waiters etc. The roof top restaurant was wonderful - what a fabulous way to start the day with a great breakfast of fresh juices and fruits,home made yoghurt, cereals, eggs plus other hot food, pastries,coffee,tea as well as a huge selection of turkish cuisine, whilst looking out over the Bosphorus, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Lunch and dinner were also marvellous, especially with that view! I will always remember a fantastic country, warm people and a great hotel which made all the difference. K

Reviews.Title: “Thorougly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: ARSAB
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time at the Yasmak Hotel. The staff were extremely helpful even to the extent of putting an extra bed into the room so the whole family (2 adults + 1 child + 1 teenager) could be together. The breakfast was excellent with terrrific views over the city. The location is also perfect for city sightseeing...all the major attractions are within walking distance of the hotel. We have already recommended this hotel to other friends who are visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “In the old city, near the main attractions, but it does'n deserve a 4* (hotel) class!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucoh99
Reviews.Content: Though it seems luxurious and spacious from its web and brochure photos, it's a small hotel with only a pair of large rooms (the angular ones you can see by the entrance, they call their "almost suites", furnished with a king, armchairs, nice wardrobes, a small sitting room and a marvellous bathroom). I stayed twice in August 2009, in a double room (117) with a friend first, and then in a single (502)...both were really old-furnished, small, with small windows (no-light!) and had a strange smell (particularly the double on the 1st floor). The bathroom was nice, mainly in the double. The single was very noisy, even because it was under the restaurant. The elevators were a little slow. I had wi-fii in all rooms but it did't work all the time, and yo have to ask the reception for the password. The best part of the hotel is the breakfast room/restaurant terrace, on the top of the hotel...you can have a wonderful view of the whole Istanbul, but I guess you can have the same view by other hotels/roofs, mainly in Galata. The position is nice to reach museusm, mosques, Sophia museum, Grand Bazar, .., but it's not so nice for te evening, especially if you want a "european style" of night (best international restaurants, pubs, locals are all located in the Galata zone or the north). So, it's a good place where to stay if you want to discover the city, but it's not too refined, and it's too expensive for its services.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Azerbaijan307
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, amazingly hospitable stuff. Rooms are very clean and comforable and the location is perfect fo all tourists. I do recommend this hotel for everyone, willing to travel in Istanbul. Thank you for kind stuff and beautiful hotel. Best and kindest regards from the room number 307, from Azerbaijan!

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan Hotel is one of the best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MJCarry
Reviews.Content: Hotel Yasmak Sultan is located at one of the most beautiful corners of Istanbul. In the historic district of Eminonu, it's a few minutes from Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque which are at the cradle civilizations. Its terrace restaurant is perfect for a quite dinner with an unmatched scene of the Bosphorus and Golden Horn. all. Me and my wife felt very comfortable during our stay, the staff is very friendly, we especially enjoyed the company of PR person Gosde..She is a very lovely and knowledgeable lady...This boutique hotel is not one of the most luxurious hotels in Istanbul but certainly one of the most authentic ones with a unique feeling. Stay next to palaces of emperors and sultans at an affordable price..I wish I had more time to stay there and enjoy the city...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: AbdullahIstanbul
Reviews.Content: I am overall pleased with this hotel because of its friendly staff, location and value. We took two double rooms with two extra beds. We were a family of 6, a couple with 12, 10, 6 and 2 year old children. The receiption guy (Engin) was extreemly helpful when I forgot to tell him that we are extending our stay. The staff at the restaurant at the terrace had a surprise birthday cake for our 2 year old son. The only negative I can comment is the rooms are some what not sound proof, But in general we are very satisfied with our stay in this hotel, compared to the other three hotels we stayed in Istabbul.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaAlex
Reviews.Content: After a long day walking and enjoying around markets, mosques, bazaars, historic places, in this unique city, all of it too close to Yasmak Hotel, you will get here a wonderful bath, even a very nice Turkish bath, a good rest, and a marvelous dinner, everything with a very comfortable, very well equipped, a marvelous five stars service.

Reviews.Title: “Extremley Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yasmak Sultan for 5 days. The location is unbeatable - we walked to every major attraction from our hotel. The hotel is right on light rail transit line which took us easily to and from the airport. The surrounding shops and restaurants are charming. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was delicious and authentic. I'd stay there again. Vanessa

Reviews.Title: “Happy,no complaints, would love to return”
Reviews.Author: globe2312
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days and found the hotel absolutely clean and comfortable,with good facilities, linens and bathrooms. We spent the days out, in any case, after enjoying sumptuous breakfasts which we loved, and could hardly do justice to, there was so much variety. They gave us a complimentary airport pick-up, and the booking procedure was easy and prompt through the internet. We loved the place and would certainly return,if we could. The only hitch was the internet, which was expensive, and we spent extra money in trying to figure out the Turkish keyboard which was somewhat different from the English one

Reviews.Title: “If you like fresh air in your room and suffer from claustrophobia don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: goldieAustralia
Reviews.Content: Although clean and well located the standard rooms in this hotel are small, dim and lacking in good ventilation due to what seem like bottom hinged windows. The views from these rooms are either into a busy street or near building sites and the furniture had definitely seen better days. Breakfast was average with some of the staff seeming to be half asleep at 9am. Internet erratic and expensive combined and the exchange rate at the desk at times up to 25% less than others in the area. There are a number of other hotels in this area that offer much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: spock707
Reviews.Content: So close to major sights - Blue Mosque, Hagai Sofia, Topkapi, Cisterns and very easy access to transportation that takes you to all other sights. Rooms are a little small but adequate. Rooftop restaurant is fine and dinner is quite good especially if you want to escape from the hassle of being pressured by nearby restaurants. Service is very good. Front desk personnel could be a little bit friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “The Yasmak Sultan I would recommend for anyone...good memories, wonderful staff...”
Reviews.Author: Ozgreencafe
Reviews.Content: Yasmak Sultan is in a great position it is close to the Bazzar and the antiquites of Istanbul. I recommend a visit to the area called Taxim its full of life, cafes, markets, resturants, we had some gozleme at a resturant called Hala s they taste awsome..I would like to say hi to Gozde and the staff at the Yasmak for making our holiday there memorable and a big hi from downunder to you all will see you again some day for sure... Hulya & Tunjay from Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay You could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Michaela230000
Reviews.Content: Stayed there five nights great value great no fantastic position clean rooms great breakfast great view wonderful and helful staff cheap massage food. Air conditioning and hot water great. Easy to find. Near all the top spots, walking aya sofia blue mosque topkari palace grand bazaar. Left my passport and money in the safe when I left. The management sent it by private car to the airport for me and did not charge us. The female staff are gorgeous, I am male can't help myself. Great recommendations of places to go. Michael Anthony from Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “We would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: wweg12
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for five nights. When we arrived, the manager told we must stay for one n ight in a closeby three star hotel due to some construction work. The next day we moved to Yasmak. Got free airport transfer for the trouble. The location of the hotel is great. Walking disnatnce to allmajor sights and EminÃ¶nÃ¼ harbour, from where the ferries shuttle to the other side of the Bosbor - Asia. Neigbourhood is nice and easy, lots of bars and restaurants. Roof top breakfast restaurant was cozy with a nice view. Staff was polite and spoke excellent English. The only con was that the wireless internet connection was very unstable, at least on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff... just don't go for a basic room”
Reviews.Author: AllyPaly
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is ideal. Turn left out the hotel and walk for 5 minutes and you are in the main area for the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace. Turn right, go to the end of the street and turn right again and you are at the ferry terminal, again in about 5 minutes. The Grand Bazaar is within easy walking distance. A tram station is just at the end of the street also. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance ( we recommend Pasazade and Istanbul restaurants at the nearby Erboy Hotel) All in all the location gets 5 stars. We found the staff to be very friendly and had no experience of "surly and bad mannered" Turks at all. Buffet breakfast was fresh and very tasty. Food in the restaurant was good without being exceptional. The location of the roof top bar and restaurant provided spectacular views across the city. We stayed in a deluxe room and it was spacious without being luxurious. Do not expect any views from your room because you are in a built up area with buildings to all sides. The room was air conditioned and was quiet. A kettle was supplied with complimentary tea and coffee ( no milk or whitener though) and water. The room also had a minibar but you had to have a deep pockets to pay for any drinks out of it......be wary. However it did have room to store you own drinks if required. The only downside we could see was small rooms. When walking to breakfast a few of the inner corridor room doors were left open by the cleaners. Looking in we were surprised how small they were......and when we say small we mean "not much room to swing a cat" small. If space is what you are after go for deluxe every time. I would stay at this hotel again as all in all it did what it said on the tin. Alan , Edinburgh, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Uknaj
Reviews.Content: The Yasmak Sultan Hotel is very well located for many of the key tourist sites...no more than a ten minute stroll to Ayina Sofia and the Blue Mosque, with great views from its roof top balcony. We stayed there for five nights in May this year. The staff were all very friendly and helpful during the course of our stay. We can definitely recommend the buffet breakfasts too! The bedrooms were slightly on the small side and the television was also slightly small - but these are minor points. When we next go back to Istanbul we'll stay here again. Well recomended, Mr And Mrs Z Cheshire

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel for the sites”
Reviews.Author: lorriejo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly as it described itself situated on the corner of the street close to bars and,restaurants in good walking distance of all the main attractions with the tram service at the bottom of the road. As for the hotel itself the rooms were clean (good maid service) staff very helpful and polite epecially the hotel liason lady, rooftop restaurant great, rooms average size, all in all good hotel, good value for money

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: chowdhury5
Reviews.Content: my patner and myself had were in istanbul for 4 nights. we got to the hotel and were told there was a problem with the electricity in the room we had booked. The manager had kindly asked us to stay in the 3 star next door for a night untill he could resolve the problem. The next morning we were moved back to the yasmak sultan hotel and were given an ensuite room. The staff were very friendly and spoke good english. They catered for all our needs (even when we requested a glass of milk at 1am). the room itself had a large confortable bed and it was very spacious, the bathroom even had a jacuzzi. only fault i could find was the water.... it had a chlorine swimming pool spell and taste (not the drinking water)

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and friendly hotel in the historic area of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cliveinoz
Reviews.Content: On a recent tour of Turkey we stayed for our first few days at the Yasmak Sultan Hotel in Istanbul. It sits in a side street just off of the main route up to the historic area of Istanbul. From the outside it is not that imposing but when you walk into reception you are immediately given a warm greeting by friendly and efficient staff. The rooms are comfortable clean and have all the necessary facilities, but not as large as say a Marriot, but the location more than compensates as you do not spend that long in your room. The restaurant is at the top of the hotel and has wide panoramic views of the Golden Horn and the city beyond, and from the lovely rooftop terrace you see Haigha Sophia in all its glory when lit up at night. The evening restaurant food is excellent and again service friendly and attentive. Not many hotels where the restaurant manager can find time for nice chat over breakfast. Breakfast is a superb running buffet that sets you up for the rest of the day. Walk out of the hotel turn right up the hill and you are only 10 minutes away from Sophia, Blue Mosque, Cistern Basillica and Topkapi. Leave the hotel in the opposite direction and you are 10 minutes from the Bazaar, Golden Horn and main station. Surrounding the hotel are many local bars, cafes where you can while away the evenings whilst smoking apple tobacco througha water pipe. If the Yasmak is full the company have two other hotels in the same street and on our return trip before flying back to UK we stayed in the Yasmak Romance... same high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, Service, Charm and Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: Cyclone57
Reviews.Content: This was an outstanding choice of hotel for our first stay in Istanbul. The hotel has a real charm about it. It is very clean and located close to everything in the old city. This alone would have made it an ideal venue. However, there is much more to the Yasmak. The staff were as welcoming and friendly as any I have ever encountered. They were genuinely interested in sharing in our holiday experience and did everything possible to enrich that experience. We felt at the end of our stay as though we were leaving very close friends, which is amazing given that our stay in the hotel was only 10 days. We have outstanding memories of Istanbul and very fond ones of the Yasmak Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel , excellent location near all facilities”
Reviews.Author: hatemmm
Reviews.Content: the breakfast was very good , a lot of choice. the hotel was very quiet we can sleep till late............ it was sunny during the week but a little cold outside, the staff of the reception and the restaurant were very helpful and friendly. Hatem+Patrizia

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Aus_Bris_Travel
