Reviews.Content: We had just had a terrible time at a hotel two doors down, and we walked in and it was lovely to be greeted with a smile and immediate help. All staff were lovely and helpful. We definitely had a lovely time and were really impressed with the service.

Reviews.Title: “That was really amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuzieSuzLondon
Reviews.Content: I had spent 6 days in Istanbul and I had stayed in this fantastic hotel. First of all, i loved my room so much. It was really clean and comfy. Secondly the service was fantastic and staff was so friendly. Special thanks to Ms. Kurt by the way, she was really kind. If I go to Turkey again, I'll definitely choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The service and attention of a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeixBrussels
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located in the old city center, this hotels offers very nice and clean rooms, together with a superb located dining / breakfast room on the top floor, with a magnificent view over the bay. From the bar, you have a very nice view of the Ayasofia. This hotel makes the Istanbul experience, unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy your stay at Yasmak Sultan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anpefi
Reviews.Content: We (6) people stayed at Yasmak Sultan Hotel 3 nights Apr-May '09 and were very happy. The Hotel is situated so nicely to all attractions and also easy acces to Taksim area by train or walking. Athmosphere in the Hotel was great, so helpfull persons and always so kind as well! Rooms were clean and nice and the breakfast room had nice view as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel that's conviently located”
Reviews.Author: lawharvey
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good. The staff was friendly, attentive and accomodating. The rooms were clean and relatively beautiful and i like the fact that we were able to get onto the internet without charge. The food was very good, and i like the fact that you can order room service 24/7. The only critisism i have was the fitness center...hardly any good equipment and the space felt too cramped. Overall though i give the hotel a strong "Very Good" rating

Reviews.Title: “The kindness and thoughtfulness of the staff”
Reviews.Author: marianfaithful
Reviews.Content: A pleasant welcome greeted us here. They were happy to book tours and recommend excursions. Their central location made all the highlights walkable. The food was consistently good (especially the breakfasts!). Ms Kurt gave generously of her time. Thank you for a unforgetable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and awesome break in the city..!”
Reviews.Author: MandSManchester_UK
Reviews.Content: The service we received at Yasmak Sultan was excellent. The reception staff are very helpful and gave use useful tips and information about getting around the city. The reception also arranged the Bosphereus Cruise for us which was a guided tour and we would totally recommend it to others. Other staff members, managers and the maids were just as equally helpful, friendly and courteous. The room was appropriate size for us. It was well maintained and cleaned everyday. The Hotel has got a restaurant on the Terrance with glass windows and you can view the city and the Aya Sopia Mosque which is a beautiful sight to see when sipping over a glass of orange juice at breakfast. The breakfast provided was lovely and had a varied buffet which was delicious..! The location of the hotel is perfect as its situated in the hub of the city. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazzar are approx 10 mins walk away. (Depending on how many stops you make in between your walk to peep through shop windows for some Turkish Treats..!) They have cafes, restaurants to suit all tastes buds. Also the Spice Bazzar is not to far from the hotel either. You have street vendors selling boiled/grilled sweet corn, roasted chestnuts and Turkish people like their bread so you will see vendors selling fancy bread and cheese. You can travel on an open top tour bus which gives you a guided tour of the city and the beauty of the tour is you can get a day pass and hop on and off the bus as and when you like. You can travel on the tram but when the weather is nice and dry we recommend to explore the city by foot as thatâ€™s what we did and thoroughly enjoyed it! We felt the pinch of the credit crunch in regards to the currency as the pound sterling is so low so we didnâ€™t get much bargains as we anticipated however we did bring back lots of Turkish delight and apple tea...! we would recommend visiting the city and staying at Yasmak Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money, nice, clean, friendly hotel with superb location”
Reviews.Author: FleurtheGirl
Reviews.Content: Yasmak Sultan was one of the hotels which among I could choose to be my hotel while during a 4 night Istanbul weekend trip offered by air company. I chose Yasmak Sultan based on mainly these reviews here and what can I say, those were absolutely right. The hotel staff is friendly, the rooms clean, the service nice and fast (there was something broken in our room, but the repairing service worked prompty and that's awesome) cleaning is very good, breakfast is fantastic not to mention the views... The list could be endless. There's even a small "fitness room" downstairs, which is not advertised as it is kind of a corner, but in mood for some sweating, that will do. I didn't personally tested the sauna and massage service they offer, but it is a nice plus. The only minus I could say is that the travel service they offer (extra ones) are very HIGHLY overcalculated what comes to prices. Like picking from the airport is 35 euros, where in other agencies around the corner offer it with4-5 euros and the public transportation works also well and the cost is then under 2 euros... Also the Bosphorus cruise they suggest is like 70 euros (incl. lunch) or something absurb like that, where in you get those with local providers much much cheaper... But it is great hotel and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very God stay, especially for the service! Thank you Gozde Kurt”
Reviews.Author: AaronSosa
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. I give 100 points to the Hotel Yasmak Sultan that will be product of quality of the service like attentive, nice persons and many adjectives more that make your stay beautiful internally and externally, and that together with all your companions of work and the installations: Restaurant, bar, kitchen, rooms and receipt, Yasmak Sultan does of the hotel a hospitable and extremely agreeable place. Gozde Kurt, thank you for all. Attentively Aaron .M.Sosa Garza.

Reviews.Title: “Tank you very much, Gozde Kurt PR Mngr. You really made our stay unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: shsservicesllc
Reviews.Content: It is a very pleasant hotel with an excellent service. Personally I enjoy the personal and kind treatment of the places that I visit, and I can found it there. Gozde Kurt was very kind with us, she is very profesional, we are very tankful. The people are those that make special the places...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: RussiaMoscow
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 13 students staying in the hotel and everything went smoothly. Students and teachers needed to do work but the internet was slow and it was hard to upload files. Great location for walking to Galata and and seeing Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: FoeOfMordor
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in the old town near Gulhane tram stop - excellent location. A 10 minute walk to explore the famous sites of Topkapi Palace, Ayia Sofia and Blue Mosque. You can enjoy breakfast (which was very good) looking out over these sites! You can also explore further afield really easily - the tram is a very good way of getting around and only costs 1.4 lira (about 60p) per journey regardless of how many stops you go. Extremely helpful and friendly staff and thought the newsletter they have to advise you of things to do in and around Istanbul was an excellent service. Rooms were comfortable and clean and noise outside was kept to a minimum. They also do airport pickups if you require this, which is very handy if you don't know where you are going initially - however the roads in Istanbul are packed at all times and the rights of way come down to who's got the biggest vehicle! Just a couple of minor things: - Gym is limited to just cardio equipment but they are looking at extending this to include weights - When settling your bill, if you pay by credit card, the amount debited will be in Turkish Lira so you may wish to settle your account via Euros instead As for Istanbul, it is a fantastic city with so much to see that we are coming back next year. As well as the Old Town, make sure you go up Galata Tower (although they charge 10 lira per person the views are worth every penny) and go to the town of Eyup (a very important place for Muslims) and when you are buying Turkish delight or the gorgeous Baklava make sure you haggle (you'll get a lot of money off the initial price).

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler2032
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay for the 4 nights in the hotel but i had to leave for Beirut for urgent situation (medical reason ) So, the Manager of the hotel was so kind and he did not charge me the 2 nights left ..it was very nice of him The hotel is so good and the service too ... next time , In istanbul I will check in In Yasmak Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Youthleader
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean, good location, good service and good breakfast. Very nice and helpful staff, especially the very nice woman who takes care of the public relations. I can reccomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: radulescuvm
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was one of the most memorable I have stayed in throughout my travels including the United States and many European countries. The staff was fantastic: kind, extremely helpful, with inexhaustible patience. Particularly kind and helpful were Engin, Mesut, Savas, Huseyin. And the hostess of the restaurant Gozde Kurt was charming and brilliant and rendered the whole experience of having breakfast in the Roof Restaurant with an enchanting panoramic view of the city even more meaningful. The location of the Hotel is ideal, the rooms charming. The beds could be a little bigger, though they are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: garp64
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Yasmak Sultan very much! The staff was very friendly, and learned us some turkish words. Loved the restaurant and breakfast place with the great view. Tesje Gur e Dirrim... (don't know if I write it right) Bart en Rakinah

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: almerefamily
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was great during our five days stay. The Yasmak Sultan Hotel is a pleasant hotel, with a beautiful restaurant on the top floor. In the morning a tastefull breakfast. And one evening we had diner in the hotel. Professional waiters, beautiful views on the Golden Horn. The room was average but the staff was perfect! If we visit Istanbul once more, we know where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CameronandKristy
Reviews.Content: This litte hotel is in a great spot for anyone wanting to experience the spoils that Istanbul has to offer. It is not more than 5-10 mins walk to the most popular historical and touristic sights but also is well positioned to get the tram anywhere else. We unfortunately had the top floor which was great for views but our roon was directly under the kitchen and at the bottom of the roof top terrace stairs which meant we got the tap dancing on the roof of the kitchen staff and the rowdy noises associated with going to and leaving meals but trusty ear plugs save the day again. That was not enough to write a bad wors about the hotel. One word of warning, triple rooms do not exist, they sinply are a fold out couch, fortunatley we could improvise but bear this in mind if you Book a triple. Breakfast is served in the most spectacular roof terrace, the views of the Bospeheros are just amazing. Avoid eating in the Old Town, there are so many great places to eat by walking or getting a tram to the other side of the bospherous and catching the fanicular up, walk on the main drag then down some of the back alleys, food is twice the quality and half the price. Good 3 star quality hotel. Bring Earplugs, call to prayer can be fun with the windows open!

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak sultan Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LoveIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Fantastic time in Istanbul, Love Istanbul We stayed at this hotel for one week. Breathtaking views, Great location and walking distance to many of the attractions in the Sultan Ahmed district; Haggia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, bisilica Cistern, Grand and Spice Bazaar etc... Our room views were stunning, Haggia Sophia and from the roof terrace; the Bosphorus straits! The Hotel is not too small or too big, managable size with fantastic facilities. Nice clean, comfortable, spacious and quiet environment. Incredible service, fantastic! The staff were very helpful, friendly, caring, chatty and made us feel right at home. Very efficient and nothing was too much trouble for them. Breakfast every morning on the roof terrace, we ate like kings, absolutely amazing!! A must stay at this hotel, place great attention to detail and are constantly striving to improve their fantastic service. We would definately go back to this hotel again and again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Reospeed1
Reviews.Content: After Arrived to istanbul, we expected a normal place to stay as all pleaces do, but Yasmak Sultan hotel was the perfect place to spend quality time with my wife, inside the hotel is very nice rooms are so clean and food was great also we felt that we are in home and this is allow us to spend a nice vacation i will be there again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Super location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Establishedtrekker
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our first visit to Istanbul and it could not have been much better. The hotel is situated close to most of the interesting sites in the old quarter, has an excellent dining rooftop restaurant, and the staff were so friendly and helpful when this was needed. The internal turkish bath facilities are also a plus. Whilst we took in visits to the north side of the Golden Horn for the more modern areas we are certainly glad that we were staying where we were. A trip up the Bosphorus is a must for any visitor. For eating out would recommend '360' rooftop restaurant on Istiklal main street ( wonderful views & really good food ) and 'Mosaik' off Divan Yolu in the old quarter for the taste of authentic turkish fare. -Well travelled of Woking, UK.

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Lingos
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 5 people in the hotel for 4 nights and had 2 double and 1 single room. The rooms were nice,some with view on the Aya Sofia! The staff was very friendly and small problems were solved immediately. Every morning we had a chat with the very friendly PR manager Gozde who is providing guests tips about excursions. The breakfast is all right with a beautifull view on the Aya Sofia and the Golden Horn/Bosporus. Most of the time on city trips you don't spend much time in the hotel at daytime but walk around the city. This Hotel is ideal situated for visiting all the highlights of this exciting city. 10 minutes walking to Aya Sofia,Topkapi palace and Blue Mosque on one side and 10 minutes to the Galatabridge ,ferries and Egyptian Bazar on the other side. For excursions further away the fast tram is right next door. Nice shops and good restaurants are around the corner. We hope to back to Istanbul someday and then we will surely stay in the Yasmak Sultan(especially when they will have a swimmingpool on the rooftop next year, as we heard) Fam van Lingen,Holland

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: japieklaas
Reviews.Content: I just came back with my parents from a 5 day stay in Yasmak Sultan. I don't need much words... the hotel is great! I can recommended it to everyone. The rooms are clean and they look good. The beds are also good. But especially the place of the hotel is excellent (only 10 minutes away from all the big highlights) and the service is really good. The PR manager is a sweety and so are the other members of the hotel and restaurant. Go there! Wiecher

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Ä°n Ä°stanbul !”
Reviews.Author: akebo
Reviews.Content: We are very hapy to be here and find the people in Hotel are every Day kind to us and help us wÄ±th all our QuestÄ±ons. Rooms are good and cleaningboy kind to us! Reception and public relations manager also doing all for us. Also we are very hapy to stay in thÄ±s Hotel! Ake and Bo Wraghe <wraghe@tele2.se>

Reviews.Title: “istanbul old city”
Reviews.Author: mike4545
Reviews.Content: i had been stayed yasmak sultan sultanahmet it was amazing experiences in me and my family if u re interested in old cities i think so it will be nice choosing for u.....

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan-An Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: CrabtreeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Our five nights at the Yasmak Sultan in Istanbul proved to be an excellent choice. The hotel is located in an ideal location to provide walking distance access to many of the 'must see' sights, or to public .transport to go further afield. We found the staff at the hotel to be most helpful, providing prompt resposes to requests and regular enquiry as to our comfort and needs being met.. Staff were also friendly, engaging in conversation and causing us to feel that we were more than just another guest. We were impressed by the PR person who produced a daily newsletter giving information on local weather, events, and places of interest. This was accompanied by personal enquiry during breakfast into our stay and service. Comfort and service was of a high standard and we would be pleased to return to the Yasmak Sultan should the opportunity arise again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: pinkNorwich
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time of staying at the Yasmak Sultan and it won't be the last. The hotel is ideally situated in Sultanhamet and very close to all public transport. The rooms particularly on the higher floors are very spacious and well equiped with those on the lower floors still to a high standard. One of the joys is taking an early breakfast and watching the sun come up over the mosques and over the bospherous from the roof top restaurant. The staff and management are very efficent and friendly. As the hotel is situated in the old town there isn't a pool but the Yasmak offers turkish bath and other health facilities. Most visitors like to try out all the different restaurants in Istanbul but if you have had enough sight seeing for the day the hotel also has a very good restaurant. We would be happy to recommend this hotel. Mike and Anita Hanley UK

Reviews.Title: “good location but airconditioning does not work”
Reviews.Author: AAW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We had booked for a double room with twin beds but they put us in a small double room with single king size bed. the room was so small there was no place to move. When we told them we had booked a double room with twin beds they gave it on the 2nd day. This room was sligthly bigger but the carpets were worn out and the air conditioning did not work. They did not do anything about the a/c even after we complained. The bathrooms were clean and the sheets were also clean but they did not change the sheets for 5 days. Also housekeeping did not bother to wash the glasses for 5 days. The roof top restaurant has a good view and the buffet breakfast served there is good but there is no variation, so it is good if you stay for only 2 nights, beyond that you get bored. The location of the hotel is excellent , walking distance from all the historical sites. There are a number of small turkish joints around the hotel, you can eat at a new restaurant everyday without repeating even if you stay for 15days. It is good value for money if you are looking for a 3* hotel but do not stay there in summer.

Reviews.Title: “5 star Location / 3+ star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsj5777
Reviews.Content: Stayed 14-20 September, 2008. Booked as a package with air on Expedia. Bottomline, if you are looking for a comfortable room at a tremendous location and reasonable cost - then I would highly recommend this hotel. We got to the hotel from the airport via the train, got off on the tram transfer stop and took the tram to the hotel all for about $3pp. The hotel is located just 50 meters from a less crowded tram stop and a 10 minute walk from Hagia Sophia, Blue and New Mosque, Harbor, Archeological Museum and Tokapi Palace/Harem. The tram can get you quickly to the Grand Bazaar and locations across the Golden Horn. Breakfast is wonderful and is served on the roof top restaurant with great views of Istanbul and in particular Hagia Sophia. The staff was friendly and helpful in all aspects - restaurant, housekeeping and front desk. The room was comfortable but just 3 star. The air conditioning was sporadic when it cooled outside but was still warmer in the room. The wi-fi is also sporadic but not a big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BanuBas
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in June. The rooms are not so big enough but clean. Reception seems professional and breakfast is diverse.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the historic centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: harmag
Reviews.Content: Yasmak Sultan Hotel is a nice hotel near the Topkapi Palace. The hotel is perfect for travellers who prefer staying close to the main attractions. The rooms are clean, and the restaurant at the roof top has a magnificent view. Will consider staying there again the next time I am in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: mbadler
Reviews.Content: Checking in was ok, pleasent people. The room was warm AC not working well, room was alway warm. Advised the desk several times, but nothing was done. The best was our room was not cleaned for two days and couldn't get extra towels

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DirkAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is simply on a superb location in Istanbul, very easy to get by public transport, stops nearly in front of the door, and the trip it self from the international airport is very nice because it already passes many highlights of the city. It is Located very close to all te best Istanbul has to offer, every thing is in walking distance from the Galata tower, to the grand Bazaar to the blue mosque, the staff are very friendly and helpfull, comunication in the english language is no problem, and the room and the building is very clean, the restaurant and the terrace has one of the best views of any restaurant in the world and that is a fact, simply amazing you must see it yourself

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: nomadWales
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel: courteous and extremely helpful staff, great location, as main attractions are within walking distance; rooms clean and pleasant; very good buffet breakfast; photos on hotel website do not do it justice. Would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The fantastic Yasmak Sultan”
Reviews.Author: ShubBear
Reviews.Content: The Yasmak Sultan is a fantastic local hotel in the heart of Istanbuls old city. The overall experience was amazing and made our family holiday perfect. They made my 2 year old neice so welcome. The biggest advantage of the Yasmak would have to be the location location location, its perfect for all the major tourist sites. There is also alot of local bars, restaurants and cafe which are open till late, however the area is very quiet. We also felt very safe and did not see any sign of trouble. I have to mention the views from the roof top restaurant which are stunning. Breakfast is served every morning and its a fantastic place to enjoy the excellent buffet breakfast. The staff are fantastic very friendly and accomadating. Overall the Yasmak Sultan is a clean comfortable value for money very well located hotel. It has 2 sister hotels nextdoor called the Romance and Olimpiyat which could be considered if the Yasmak is not available. I would stay there again if I went back to Istanbul and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, you wont be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan you made our stay in Istanbul unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Boulik
Reviews.Content: At the end of June my family and I travelled to Istanbul by car. We had booked the hotel through the internet and we couldn't have chosen any better!!! Where should I start, from the view from the roof terrace? Or how clean the room was? Or should I mention the position of the hotel, right in the heart of the historical Istanbul. All the important sights were at walking distance. Or should I mention how polite and yet professional all the personelle was? Any how, the room was a bit small but so clean and the bathroom so beautifu! The minibar was filled up in a generous way and the room was cleaned always after we had left the room for our daily excursions. The view on the roof was breath taking and brekfast and dinner excellent. Restaurants menu mixed in a perfect way "oriental" and european kitchen. The personelle was polite and helpful so much at the desk, as also in the restaurant or garage. We have no doubt where we are going to stay in Istanbul on our next visit. We warmely reccomend Yasmak Sultan Hotel to any traveller that knows how to enjoy their trip. And don't make a mistake of staying just a weekend, Istanbul fills up easily a full week with all the fabulous sights it has to offer a traveller. We also want to thank all the personelle of Yasmak Sultan hotel for such a good service and especially the PR manager , Eda who helped us with a personal matter that occured to us while we were there. with regards Maarit and Eystathios Bolanos Athens, Greece

Reviews.Title: “Yasmak Sultan is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JerrySVenice_Florida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yasmak Sultan for two nights when we arrived in Turkey. After two weeks of traveling throughout Turkey, we returned to the Yasmak Sultan for two nights prior to our departure for Paris. The Yasmak's staff are outstanding and their service is excellent. The rooms, though small, are very clean and comfortable. The bathroom is also small, but spotlessly cleaned. We liked the room best that faced the main street; we enjoyed opening the windows and watching Istanbul pass by. The top floor open-air dining room serves a wonderful breakfast (included in the room cost) with an extraordinary view of Istanbul and the Bosporus River. Best of all: the hotel is located within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, Haghia Sohia, and numerous small shoppes and eating establishments. When we return to Istanbul, we'll stay again at the Yasmak Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Yasmak Sultan”
Reviews.Author: Hallston
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Yasmak Sultan. Excellent position to see the best known tourist sights of Istanbul. Initial room was a little small but upgraded to junior suite which was excellent. Staff were extremely helpful with particular reference to Eva the tourist advisor and Mustafa the restaurant manager. Brilliant views from the rooftop bar and restaurant as well as good food and wine. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jsloan56
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location, 10 minute walk to everything (spice bazaar, grand bazaar, waterfront, blue mosque, etc). Our room was a little small but extremely cleam and comfortable. The views from the rooftop terrace were amazing. Every evening Mustafa would sit with us and talk about our day and make recommendations as well as help explain their culture. The turkish bath and scrub was amazing. The room could have used a clock.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for recommending this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anniek_8
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip to Istanbul we read the recommendations on this site and chose our hotel based on users' views. We were not disappointed. The hotel was excellent - it is in a great location close to all the main tourist sites in the Old City. Our room was lovely - clean and comfortable with brew facilities and a few toiletries too. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the morning buffet offered hot and cold choice options for breakfast. The rooftop restaurant has wonderful views of the Bosphorus and the food was good too (though not cheap) - worth giving yourself a treat though. We easily walked to the Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar, the Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque, the Egyptian Bazaar, the sunken palace (cistern) and the Galata Bridge and much much more. All this helped to make our first trip to Istanbul a wonderful and memorable weekend. We will definitely be back - to both the city and to the Yasmak Sultan. Thank you Trip Adviser and the Yasmak Hotel review contributors - your views helped us to choose wisely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: journalisthelsinki
Reviews.Content: Yasmin SultanÂ´s best part is itÂ´s great location. 10-15 min walk from Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazar. 50m from tram-stop. The marvellous location is well enjoyed from roof-terrace where is a bar and a restaurant. Best views to the sights, especially Hagia Sofia, and Golden Horn and Bosphorus bridge. The service in the roof-terrace is very friendly and food quite good. The rooms are on the border-line of being the boasted 4 star level but the great view, location and friendliness of the service help to bring it back to the advertised rating.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Experience”
Reviews.Author: MaryJanet
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for nearly a week with my family; my husband and two children and I should say that I could never have been so sure that Yasmak Sultan will make our first Turkey-Istanbul visit such wonderful. Not only it is very near to all touristic places, because it is placed in the Old Peninsula, but also the train station is only 20meters to the Hotel. Everybody was smiling in the hotel and trying to make your stay unforgettable and you could be sure that this smile was not an act, it was real. The best place to see the real turkish hospitality is this hotel. This is really a wonderfull hotel; rooms were clean and the quality of the meals including breakfast was great. All staff were so friendly and helpful that i regard writing this review as a duty. Thanks to all staff and the manager. Me and my husband strongly recommend you to visit Yasmak Sultan Hotel. Mary Janet, London

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxKuwait
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I spent three nights at the Yashmak Sultan right in the heart of Istanbul. The hotel is perectly located for visiting/exploring all the main tourist spots and our stay was thoroughly enjoyable. The rooms were clean, well maintained a perfect for our purposes. All the hotel staff, from the front office to the waiters in the stunning rooftop restaurant were excellent and looked after all our needs.In particular, Ergin was particularly helpful with advice and information and how to maximise our enjoyment of our trip to Istanbul. I would certainly recommend this hotel and their outstanding staff to anyone travelling on business/vacation to stay at this hotel whilst staying in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Mark50Bangkok
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from 5 wonderful nights at this hotel. From the time of check-in to check-out, the staff in all departments were superlative, despite the hotel being fully booked. Check-in was perfect with the receptionist apologising profusely for a 5-minute delay despite his being overwhelmed with many guests checking out. The restaurant and bar staff were incredibly attentive and the breakfast was more than adequate with a large selection to choose from. The guest relations manager Eda was full of excellent suggestions to see Istanbul from the local as well as the tourist side, in addition to being very warm and personal. I had a birthday there, which I did not tell the staff about, yet they noticed it on my checking in and provided a cake and a "happy birthday" song. This really is an amazing hotel- rooms were clean and the warmth of the staff made it one of my most enjoyable hotel stays ever, and I stay in hotels about 25% of each year.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul's Jewel”
Reviews.Author: BentleyLP
Reviews.Content: I want to recommend the Yasmak Sultan Hotel to any travelers to Istanbul. Intimate, comfortable and in a great location, the staff are most warm, welcoming and helpful. It is walking distance to most of Istanbulâ€™s important sites. The dining room on the roof offers perfect views of the Hagia Sofia, as do some of the rooms. I will certainly guide my friends there. Larry Leighton

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: tanneryadviser
Reviews.Content: fine attention nice rooms wonderful breakfast and meals

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: rebeccadiane
Reviews.Content: having had a nightmare at previous hotel arrived here to friendly staff great location and facilities, rooms immaculte, nothing was a problem for the staff, roof terrace restaurant has stunning views of the old city. will definetly return

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Rojcrad
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay in Istanbul. Our hotel, the Yasmak Sultan, was better than we expected. The room was comfortable, and the service excellent - and the view from the rooftop restaurant was terrific. I would particularly like to thank two young people who worked there and were very friendly and helpful. The first is Eda, a young lady who greeted us at breakfast each morning with a smile that lit up the city. The second a young waiter by the name of Tuncay - again helpful in the extreme. Having mentioned these two I have to add that all the staff were pleasant and helpful. Back to the hotel ... this is perfectly situated for the more famous attractions in the city. The Topkapi Palace, Eye of Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Spice and Grand Bazaars were in easy walking distance, and there is an abundance of good restaurants in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Americaine-in-Paris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located - within walking distance to the main tourist sites. Breakfast buffet was quite nice and ample. They do have interconnecting rooms but we did not get them, although it had been requested in advance. My husband is tall and the bed was short even in the deluxe room but reasonably comfortable. Our teenagers had a regular room with two double beds, nothing exciting but nothing to complain about either. Staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: pcraig
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend in November 2007. The hotel was just what it needed to be: clean, warm, in what seemed like a safe area and just ten minutes' walk from some of the main sites in the city. No big frills. It seems like a business hotel, but not in a bad way! The breakfast was good (lots of choice), as is the view from the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered by the staff”
Reviews.Author: Juju's_Brazil
Reviews.Content: Although it is not the Kempinsky in terms of luxuory, the fact that it is a quick walk from Istanbul's greatest landmark - the Blue Mosque - is a great argument for anyone to want to stay there. The staff is great, always very kind, knowledgable about all city sights and tours and breakfast is full of local delicatesses such as SIMITS. Considering that the traffic in Istambul is hectict, another great advantadge of Yasmak is the neighboring tram that takes you almost all over the city. Did not love the precints for gym, massage and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Quite satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: FastidiousMoscow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel for a week in November of 2007. The hotel's location is excellent - amid the old city and just 5 minutes walk from the places to be seen. Booked myself to 3 sightseeing tours through the hotel's reception - all tours start at the hotel's doorstep and are very good. Assistance from Reception Head - Erdem Zabci - was speedy and highly professional. I stayed at Sultan Suite with the price being reasonable however the room - not a suite at all !- was not so large as I had expected. The cleaning service was good, the towels changed every day. I guess this was the only room equipped with Jaccusi that we could not make function - !!Prices at the roof restaurant where we also had dinner a couple of times are unreasonably high as compared to the quality of meals. Also, since the restaurant is supposed to be functioning 24 hours and my room was just below it, I could 'enjoy' hearing stamping and objects falling right above my head all night through.

Reviews.Title: “A scam”
Reviews.Author: willie49
Reviews.Content: The hotel obviously overbooks at time of high demand and sends clients to lesser quality nearby hotels. We experienced this first hand and noticed a number of other clients in the same situation. When we arrived we were told that the room we booked 2 months earlier was not available. As we had been travelling all day we agreed to a transfer as we were offered an upgrade to a suite on return. When we returned two days later, it was no surprise to us that there was no suite available. After bartering we were finally given a decent room. The experience spoilt a otherwise fantastic stay in Istanbul. Insist on getting the room you booked and don't accept a false promise.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in the heart of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fayy
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we didnâ€™t find hotel very good because of our small room. Roomâ€™s comfort is too important for me. But we read really good reviews at Yasmak Sultanâ€™s website. Our all negative reviews changed after breakfast. Breakfast was really good, especially fresh foods, many kinds of bread, rose jam and apple tea. I canâ€™t forget their breakfast tastes, but I cannot say same thing about dinner because of their poor menu. And also, we canâ€™t forget Pinar. She smile everytime welcoming us, and she took care us too much. Thanks to Pinar, she helped us to change our room. Front desk, especially Mr. Engim, and Pinar made our stay memorable one. Our new room was excellent and comfortable. We loved Ä°stanbul, and you should see Ä°stanbulâ€™s great view at Yasmak Sultanâ€™s Roof Restaurant. We were really lucky because the hotel is located in walking distance from Topkapi Palace, St. Sophia, Blue Mosque... We reached our all wish at Yasmak Sultan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff...”
Reviews.Author: Niyota
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I weren't sure where to stay in Istanbul, our friends whom already been there recommended this place. Great location, friendly staff, well kept accommodations. Concierge was really knew what they were talking about. Especially Cagdash, gave us some great restaurant recommendations and places to see. Given the fact that we are very picky on what we eat, he made our stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: GrahamIX
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine has moved to Istanbul for 6 months and I was going over to help him settle in. We'd booked the YaÅŸmak Sultan because it was close to all the sights of Sultanahmet, it was a good price and our first choice was fully booked. It was the weekend of the end of Ramadan, so hotel room were in short supply. They were excellent in dealing with my very delayed flight, picking me up from the airport. While my room was small, it was a single - the last they had available. The decor is a little dated, but the rooms are clean and comfortable, with great water pressure (Mark Hopkins Hotel SF, please take note...) The free hotel wifi was a little spotty at times, but a quick phone call down to reception would get the router rebooted, fixing most ills (again, British and American hotels please take note!). All in all a great value hotel with great service - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “terrible service, cramped rooms”
Reviews.Author: nephron5
Reviews.Content: I ended up changing hotels because I found the rooms and bathrooms too tiny and worn out. On top of it, the staff can be pretty unfriendly at times. The manager is hospitable but I can't say the same about the rest of the staff. For the same price, or even cheaper, there are many choices for cleaner and more spacious rooms with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: johni33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year 2006. The hotel is very comfortable, the staff were very helpful. Great location, a few minutes walk from Ayasofia and the Blue Mosque and within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar (unfortunately closed during our visit) and the Galata Bridge. We had booked a double room but were allocated a twin, the housekeeper was summoned almost immediately to rearrange the beds into a double, albeit still with the single duvets. The room was comfortable but compact, not very much wardrobe space and not much walking space. Everything worked, only minor signs of wear. A nice touch was the free safe which could be keyed to your credit card. A hairdryer was supplied in the bathroom and an iron and ironing board was available on request. The lobby bar was quite comfortable but a minor irritation was having to seek out the barman a couple of times. We were supposed to have been picked up from the airport by the hotel but the driver never appeared, we resorted to a taxi for the return journey. Breakfast was taken in the roof restaurant, great views over Istanbul, reasonable selection of food, not much in the way of hot food and when it was busy things ran out quickly. Great bread if you just wanted something simple. Would we stay here again? yes!

HotelInfo.Address: Ebusuud Caddesi No:18-20 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
